name: Lake Side View
description: Wow wow wow... Our first night in Norway was a beauty. Wild camping never felt so good! Perfect spot just off from a very quiet road. The window view offers spearmint blue water with mountains and glaciers in the back ground. Kayak and fishing heaven!

name: Bird Watching Beach
description: Small pull off by the road that we found after coming back late from the whale watching expedition... Beautiful beach on the opposite side and rocky out crops for fishing. This is a great spot for bird watching and if your feeling adventurous you can climb the mountains behind. Toilets available on site. Very quiet.

name: Panoramic Mountain View
description: 5 star wild camping really doesn't get much better... We took the western side of the island down from the north as its a spectacular drive! However, pull over spots are hard to come by as its the "non tourist route". However we persevered and found this amazing spot. You need to look out for a dirt road just before (or after) the official car park, depending on what way you drive around the island. Take the dirt road over the grassy verge and pull up right next to the waters edge. Perfection!

name: Haukland Beach
description: Great wildcamping location right next to a magnificent view... Golden sands, huge mountains, etc. This seems to be a well known spot as there was other camper vans plotted up (10 in all). First time we haven't found our own beach... Hard life :) There are toilets available along with running water. Great spot especially if you have a bigger rig as there's loads of space.

name: Å parking
description: Just a parkinglot, easy to reach if you arrive from the late night ferry at Moskenes. Nice hike around a lake nearby.

name: Sleep Spot For Ferry Crossing
description: Car park... Everyone uses this for either exploring the surrounding area (beautiful) or for the ferry crossing (either night before or after arriving late). Either way it's handy and the only guaranteed sleep spot unless you go to the local camp site. Be aware the car park slopes! If you don't have ramps, park at the lower end as its flatter.

name: Mountain Wilderness
description: This one was well off the beaten track... Beautiful views and a great overnight spot if you want to explore the glacier (well worth it). Narrow and steep in parts but no problem for large vehicles. Just take it slow!

name: Port De Larvik
description: Trailer park only, free except during summer, nice and calm spot 50m from the sea

name: Lake Haukeliseter
description: In front of the lake, nice view. Toilet

name: Tveitafossen
description: Parking among trees near Tveitafossen

name: Vagamo Park
description: Free, tables, on the lake

name: Road17 Gartland
description: Nice place along road 17

name: Dam Lake Park
description: Close to the lake under the dam

name: Fjord Fiskebol
description: Nice and quiet place. Take the dirt road from the parking of the rest area, along the tunnel.

name: Parking Lot
description:
Multiple large parking lots actually meant for skiing Tourism. A lot of RVs come here. 
The lake is very cold but you can swim in it. Don't cut yourself on the ladder! There’s toilets but not working. Bad hill to drive on.

name: wild camp
description: Beautiful spot by the river beneath bluffs. Next to soccer field with lots of picnic tables and firepit. Nobody around when we were here but might not be good if there was event happening

name: pulpit rock camping
description: very very crowded place but with all services and shuttle to trailhead. didnt stay

name: Lakeside parking
description: Quiet gravel lot by the water, also grassy field for tents. No camping sign but owner said fine to camp anywhere we wanted. free

name: Dock parking lot
description: Nice spot right on water, dead end street with pretty coastal cliff waterfall views. Nice clean bathrooms, picnic tables, and electricity. Very peaceful. Free

name: Dalsoren Camping
description: Cabins and camp spots for tents and vans by the water.

name: camping trollstiegen
description: big place near bottom of switchbacks. pretty view in valley. busy. all services

name: camping
description: small lake with picnic tables. pretty spot but gross bathroom

name: rest area camping
description: large rest area by lake. bathrooms were closed. no services but ok option for night if on e6. windy

name: Campsite Goksøyr Runde
description: Totally beautiful Campground with top notch view to the sea. Perfect for hicking trips to the bird's rocks. Cheap for norway. A must see place.

name: Lovely Spot
description: Nice spot next to gravel road. Beautiful views. Wonderful blue lake 100m down the road.

name: Nesland
description: Several pullouts along a quite dirt road. Needless to say amazing views. Away from the E10 and beaten track.

name: Flotvatnet parking
description: Parking next to Flotvatnet lake and waterfall. Early June still snow

name: Stikk UT! parking
description: End of abandoned road and parking of hiking trail Stikk UT! No facilities except a picnic table.

name: Old forestry road
description: Old forestry road right off E6. The path is a bit rocky and muddy at places, definitely need a 4wd to access. If you follow the path all the way up the hill you arrive at a nice open spot.

name: Innervatnet recreation area
description: On the A6, just 30 km north of the Arctic Circle Center is this recreation area with picnic tables, fureplaces, shelters and swimming water. There is a small offroad track going south-east, follow that and you end up at an open area out of sight. Currently there are roadworks on the A6, but they stop in the afternoon and no working in the weekends, so both really noticeable

name: Sølvskeivågen beach
description: Amazing beach side spot, picnic tables and fireplace on site. Very close to Adolf Gun. At the small parking take the dirt road going down to the beach. You might need a 4×4 as it is quite a steep rocky road

name: Besides the tunnel
description: Take the path next to he tunnel for a quiet spot out of sight. You can even follow the track to get on top of the tunnel. There is a grassy area and a campfire place

name: Vettisfossen waterfall
description: very beautiful walk to the waterfall. we put 2h45 up to the down of the waterfall and 2h15 to Come back with children 12and 6 years

name: VIANOR
description:
Mechanic for Fiat (with garantie) - the only one in Narvic.
Good staff, friendly, helpful, fixed a small problem with my dieselfilter in short time.

name: just before Kongsvoll
description: Several parking on this road where you can stay for a night or just  a walk to see muskoxen wich is very easy and incredible! after one hour walking on the red walk we saw 3 of them (they are 300), becareful to keep distance...and enjoy!

name: Sæbø Camping
description: Nice camp site by a lake. All amenities good and nice view when not to full.

name: Wild camping in the wood
description:
A good spot in the end of dirty road. Good view to the mountains.
Internet 4G.

name: Rest Area
description: Rest area with a good view to fjord, some tables and seats right side of road.

name: Nes camping
description: Nice quiet place, clean sanitary facilities.

name: Parking lot in a view point
description: Parking lot with a nice view to fjord and glaciar. Quiet and nobodie comes to this area.

name: spot in the wood
description: There is 2 spots in the end of dirty road, middle of the wood and pretty close to the river. Quiet and lonely.

name: Eggum
description: 100kr by night . great walk to do and with chance good place to see the midnight sun

name: perfect spot at river
description: A perfect spot at a quiet and clean river. Entrance at a small dirty road.

name: big area to camping
description: A big area to camping. No facilities, just a spot for a night. Good view to the mountains.

name: AutoMester
description: primarily cars etc not motorbikes but helpful and friendly.

name: SEM Mechanic
description:
motorcycle mechanic - did a great job getting us back on the road.  speak English 

+47 986 74 681

name: Norevikane Fagernes Hyttesenter
description: Very nice and quit small camp site. Ideal for campers. Place is directly located on the fjord.

name: Odda Camping
description: Nice campsite, direct at the bank of Lake Sandvevatnet. Toilets, Dish Washing facilities absolutely OK.

name: Laukvik
description: several places where you can stay in this little village. very quiet and nice people.amazing midnight sun if the weather is good!

name: Sigerfjord
description: area with picnik tables just near a beach. good spot for fishing near the boats

name: Nyksund
description: several places to stay near the village with beautiful views, great walk to go to Stø

name: Waterfall Camp Side
description:
Gravel place near Lake and waterfall. It's just outside Molde near the street. 
You won't hear the Waterfall or the Street if you park right.

name: Remote hidden Parking Lot
description: Large Gravel Lot with dump toilet and trash Containers. Very Remote just aside the street but very quiet.

name: Rivercamp
description: Great Place next to River. 100meter away to Road but quiet in the Night. Small road to the Place.

name: Øvre Eidfjord
description: Small campsite next to a mountainroad, fireplace. Next to a nove whitewater river and some nice offroad hiking trails. Real wildcamping as there are no further facilities. Beautiful mountian views

name: Road side camp Peer Gynt Veien
description:
Several camp spots at a lake. Next to Peer Gynt Veien but wuite beautiful.

Road has 80kr toll but the landscape is worth it, especially if you stay overnight.

Good hiking in the area.

name: Road side camp with view
description:
Gravel parking lot with wooden benches and tables. Great view. Close to road.

Got drinking water and bread in the restaurant near by.

name: Free Water And Dump Station
description: Big parking lot with free water and dump station. We didn't spend the night but probably is possible as there is no signal saying that is forbidden. Just next to the road, so it's a bit noisy.

name: Perfect Lake Beach
description: Calm and beautifull lake beach with mountains view. There is a waterfall nearby and nobody came. Right next to a campsite, follow the road and enter the next dirty road.

name: Eibiella Way
description: Nnice spot at the river. For tent or rv.

name: Bessheim
description:
Great option if you face a few days of bad weather like we did.

Very affordable, generous and very cosy indoor area. Great staff. Feels like home.

name: Quiet parking in walking distance to center
description: Quiet parking lot in walking distance to center. Close to entrance of harbor.

name: majas Place.1
description: great place direct on a smal gravel-beach with a nice view over the lake. Not for heavy (7,5t +) trucks! Access  is a smal path, exactly on the other side of a parkingspace. First - park here and go down to have a look what the waterlevel is about...!!

name: Lofotes at its best
description: great Place near the Sea, some sheeps are walking there every night

name: Fossen
description:
Follow a gravel road for a few kilometers. After a short time you will see plenty of wild camp spots on the right and left of the road. At the end is a bigger parking place, you can also camp here.
Very peaceful, because no houses around and no cars/ people came here (in may). You can see the mountain, a waterfall and a fjord from here. There is also a hiking trail, a river and possibilities for campfires.
Internet 4G+ (not available everywhere).

name: Beautiful quiet place at lake front
description: This quiet place, 1km down the main road is perfect if you like to stay on your own, with a beautiful view but not too far from your next destination. 2 vehicles would fit if you know each other. don't be scared of the dirt track leading to this spot, it's short and I easily made it with my 2WD 6.8 motorhome

name: Beautiful places at waterfront
description: This spot is a blast! 5-6 separated flat places (10m from each other) right at the waterfront offer a beautiful view and quiet nights 30min from tromsø. Take your trash so this places stays. It can be windy. take the travel road by the electricity transformator (before the tiny bridge when you come from tromsø) to acess those amazing free spots. You can easily fit motorhomes up to 10m

name: Beautiful lakeside, small waterfall/rapid in front of you
description: At the end of a road leading to some boats, great little place you can park your car/tent. Just a stumble away from fresh water.

name: Al Camping
description: Lovely campsite in a green meadow on the banks of the river. A very small and quiet place, a good antidote to the large Scandinavian camp grounds.  They also have some small modest cabins. We paid 170 kr for an unpowered site. No washing machines or wifi but they do have a little kitchen area. Good short walks on the river.

name: Parkingspot close to Larkollen campsite
description: Quiet parking lot close to the beach! Accessible for all vehicles. Good internet service!

name: Voringfossen
description: Overflow car park at the bottom of the Voringfassen waterfall. Great spot, stunning views, toilets nearby, no charge. Turn right after entering the car park and follow old road up about 100 metres.

name: Glacier views
description: Follow a dirt service road between a couple of glacier lakes, a few places to camp on the knoll before dropping down. The track continues to the little dam.  Stunning views of mountains, lakes and glaciers.

name: Green parched parking lot
description: Next to established campground open green space where u have to pay in day time. They guys at reception told me its ok to camp during the night. And it is sheltered from wind from sea. 50m from water

name: Port for Shipping
description: Come here for shipping forwards Lofoten.

name: Arctic Circle
description: This is the touristy arctic circle center

name: Parking near the beach
description: Parking lot with several spots to park for the night. Close to the road but quiet. Could be windy. Tonight we were 8 motorhome.

name: Parking just before Gjesvaer
description: Nice small gravel parking lot with picnic tables and an old fishboat. Place for 1 or 2 motorhomes.

name: Nordkapp
description: Big parking lot of Nordkapp. Entrance 275 nok per person + 100 per vehicle (24h). Very windy but definitively worth the visit (the panoramic film in the visitor center is beautiful).

name: Parking near beaches
description: Parking with place for several vehicles. Close to small beaches.  Quiet at night.

name: Parking Henningsvaer
description: More a parking than a camping but a good place if you want to visit the beautiful town of Henningsvaer. Toilet available, dump station for cartdridge only. 200nok per vehicle.

name: Sund Fiskermuseum parking
description: We spent the night on the parking of this wonderful small museum. Beautiful place in front of the sea. The museum worths the visit, don't miss the blacksmith workshop.

name: Skogtun Motel and camping
description: Very nice and quiet place with beautiful views on the fjords, possibilities to cayak and only 25 min drive to Bergen

name: lofthus camping
description: Cherry orchard on the Hardanger fjord and with view on the rocks of Hardangervida NP. Very beautiful if not too busy (when we were there beginning of July already extremely busy)

name: Dump station and water
description: Dump station and water. For all kind of vehicle and for free.

name: Ferry Eisdal Linge
description: Be careful. When paying the tickey they ask the lengh of your vehicle, be sure to declare the EXACT lengh all included (bikes, tires at the back,...). If you are longer than declared (even for few cm) you will have to pay 2000 nok. No discussion possible. In our ferry all campers have paid the fine !!! It is robbery!

name: Beachpoint near road 885
description: Nice Place on the end of a smal gravelroad,no turnout, on the end a big grassland with Table. A smal beach and good acces to the water for fishing.

name: Fire pit by lake
description: A perfect spot with a 2 track trail to the lake shore. Silences due to no neighbours.

name: Pine forest near water
description: A beautiful grove of pines just north of Alta within 20 metres of the water or follow a track down to grassy waters edge.

name: Tennstrand
description:
Place with a beautiful view to the „Trollfjord“
Space for two campers. Fireplace at the waterfront. Three kilometers before you can collect water and take a (hot) shower at „Raften Camping“

name: Bathplace Elgsnes
description: Nice Place at the seaside at the endl of the Road

name: Brynsetertjern
description: Beautiful campsite by a lake. Nice and with limited phone service

name: Unstad Beach
description: Beautiful place bright @ the beach. Surfers welcome

name: Leka Camping
description: It's a nice Camping with a wonderful view. The Toilets and the shower are old but ok. There are some nice panoramic Places.

name: Talvik
description: Nice Place for one night. Its behind the Shell Petrolstation Good facilitis dir free.

name: Dunnpris
description:
Good shop for eating. And many other things.  Information point. 
And gas station.

name: Selfjorden parking
description: It is easy to park, to camp and fish. It is a beautiful place.

name: Bergsetstøylen car park
description: Car parking with a Nice view. Quiet. Easy acsess to hike to the mountain.

name: Sølvbergstøylen car park
description: Nice quiet parking. Lots of old farmer cabins around. Nice view.

name: Little camp in the montain
description:
Little parking in gravel where you can park the car 
You can camp on the grass

name: Incredible viewpoint
description: Absolutely incredible view point. 360° view of the surrounding fjords. Look at the mountains to the east....View all the way out to the Atlantic to the west. Drivable in everything from a big rig or motorcycle

name: Tanafjord Camp
description: place in the mountains in landscape Perfect for wild camp 4wd necessary

name: Langfjordvieen' Alta @  Kystfort.
description: Near the city of Alta, along the E6. View on the north sea

name: Kvænangsbotn
description: Place in the Mountain.  View on the fjord. Natural landscape. Steep.

name: Demmene
description: Parking. Nice fishing lake next by. Quiet and no people.

name: Camp of svolvaer
description:
Realy nice camp near thé beach 
With a parking 
A fire 
Wood...

name: Falkeriset Close to Hardangervidda
description: Beautiful and quiet road with lots of places to wildcamp with tents. There is a large free parking lot at the start of the Falkeriset hike, along the road there are a few spots to park your car and on the end is a payed parking lot which costs 50 NOK per day, which is ideal for campingcars.

name: Beautiful spot on a road and lake close to Jettegrytene
description: On the road to the famous Jettegrytene a you can find a few places to stay at night. This specific one is large enough for a large camping car or as we did for a  nice setup with a car, 2 tents and a tarp with lots of space for the kids to play around. A lake is situated just 10 meters of the place and suitable for swimming.

name: Langevatnet
description:
Small parking area next to the lake. Ideal for an overnight camp. Big enough for 3x normal sized vehicles or 1x Truck.

There are plenty of other camping options on this road - most only take one vehicle though.

name: Little fiching port
description:
Nice little place near the water and boat. 
Its a little windy but nice

name: Overgard lemetfjellet
description: Place on the river  and the cascade. Quiet and easy access from the road

name: Rennesoy
description: Informal free campsite with toilets and picnic benches directly on the E39 (so some road noise) on the bay of Austbovagen.

name: Stop area
description: Nice parking with table, bbq, toilet and many places for tent and camping-car.

name: Norwegianwild Camp Tranøybotn
description: It's a nice Camping ground with new Toilets and Showers. They are clean. There is a Washing machine and a Dryer. The Camp is at the Water and you can go swimming.

name: Jorpeland
description: Gravel area in the next valley from Pulpit rock. The Pulpit rick area is very touristy and basically a no-go for wild camping. No camping signs everywhere, however this place was fine and we stayed here with 2x other vans. We drive around for an hour and only happened upon his place......

name: Glacier Walk start
description: Quiet place to camp the night and start the walk in the morning.

name: Little parking area
description:
Parking to sleep one night with wc. 
Information point 
And a little camping 150nok

name: River falls camp
description: Realy nice place with the river, a cabane, some wood for a little bbq

name: Campsite near a lake
description:
Nice wild campsite near a lake. Possiblity to park 200m away. The road is close and generates some noise but almost no trafic at night. The view is beautiful of the mountain around.
Possibility to swim inside the lake (not very cold as of 7 of June).

name: Faustus
description: A couple of covered picnic tables and a lakeside view just off the main road before try Atlantic road. It's a nice view and it's free unlike the parking on the Atlantic Road (which is 200 NOK) enough room for a few vehicles and a small overflow lot.

name: River camp
description:
Realy nice camp with a fire ( lot off Wood )
Nice place of grass for the tent

name: Moi Parking
description: A parking place for a little Hike. Great for one night.

name: View camp
description:
Nice place to camp and to go to the glacier 
Just with a river 
But you need a 4x4

name: Luktvatnet
description: Small pull in from the road North to Mo I Rana. Off on a gravel track, past some houses and next to the lake. The spot would probably take a group of three medium vehicles. You will need a little ground clearance to access.

name: reinsnosvatnet
description: Right next to the lake down from a small (non official) parking space. Rock is not far below so soil is mostly dry. View of the lake of course, and of all the mountains above. Very similar to the other wild camping next to it.

name: Parking at the Beach
description: You have to turn to the left after the Campground and follow the narrow street through the forest until you reach the free space at the Beach. We stood there alone for one night, some local residents passed by car but nobody told us to move, so we assume it‘s okay to stay here. Beautiful view of the bay!!

name: Beautiful spot next to the lake
description: This spot is just great. Beautiful place next to a lake between the trees. There is also a small sandy beach and one can take a dip in the lake. Very silent at night. No facilities.

name: Jettegrytene
description: Beautiful Pot holes where one can swim or stay for the night on the parking lot. Toll Street (100 Krones). Toilet next to the parking lot.

name: Fantastic spot on the river
description: Beautiful spot for the night or just to spent a relaxing afternoon. Next to the river, small beach, perfect for a swim. No facilities.

name: Nice spot next to the river
description: Beautiful spot for a swim or to stay for the night. River front only possible with 4x4. But there are also spots in the grass for non-4x4 vehicles.

name: Place next to the Fjord
description: Parking lot on the Fjord with a beautiful view. Perfect for one night. Space for 2 vans. No facilities.

name: Blavatsan dam
description:
Little place for camping in the dam wonderfull 
You can make a little fire

name: Waterfall place
description: Large parking lot with toilet, running water and electricity. The outlets are inside the toilet. The place is right next to a waterfall. Also there would be place to put up a tent if you’re willing to face the cold

name: River and fjordside what
description:
A popular rest spot with some cover.
No park benches or toilets nearby but you can use the river for water (fresh)

name: Selfjord
description: Nice little pull in by the side of the Fjord. We were originally aiming for the car park but it was full. This is a better spot, although right on the side of the track. Big enough only for 1 really. A big rig could squeeze in though.

name: Delphine cap grunnferjord
description: place on the sea. Panoramic view Obligatory 4wd. stones gound

name: Hardanger Dam Wildcamp
description:
Beautiful flat gravel place, with a scenic view in the valley and onto the lake.

The road up costs a fee of 100NOK. Most of the Road is asphalt but as you get higher it turns into a gravel and a rocky road. 4WD requirement depends on the Weather. 
The Spot offers space for max. 2 Rigs or one large rig. 
Not suitable for Pets, since there are Sheep's and Hermelins around.

name: Mefjordbotn
description: Dump station for fresh water and dumping of waste

name: Sami Camp
description: Free campsite next to the Sami shop lay-by.

name: Mosvangen Camping Stavanger
description: Nice campsite not far from the city centre of Stavanger. Located directly at a small lake in the middle of the mainland. Kitchen with inside cooking possibility, free wifi, hot showers, washing machine, dryer and swimmingpool available. We stayed for one night and it cost us (Mini van, 2 people / no electricty) 240 NOK (August 2018).

name: Nice spot next to Bitihorn in Valdres
description: Nice place in front of Bitihorn (on road 51) where you can hike up the mountain or just stay for the night.  Beautiful view to the lakes of Valdres. Close to the road but quiet at night. No facilities.

name: Porsangerfjorden
description: Nice little rest stop ideal for an overnight camp. Has picnic tables and a small kids play area.

name: Lillehammer
description:
Beautiful spot in a small forest next to a lake. Clear water, good for a swim. Lots of cows and sheep around. No facilities.

The lake is no longer accessible by car but parking 100 meters before the spot is possible. Access to the lake is of course possible on foot and (motor) bike. The place is quiet, only the sheep visit and the sound of their bell may wake you up.

name: Sunset beach.
description: If you drive the road down you'll see a lot of parking bays next to the road. We decided to follow the road till nearly the end next to the myrland beach for having the best sunset view. In every parking bay you can go with a van or if its grassy enough with a tent. Caravan should work aswell. There's a little creek next to the beach for some fresh water (dish washing, body wash,...). Its just an amazing view.

name: Valley View Canp
description: From the parking area there are a few places for Rigs in the Wood. There are Firepits and Picknic Tables around.

name: Beautiful Lake
description:
Next to the E10, just a few kilometres to the border to sweden is a quiet, lonely lake. The way up is a little hidden (we missed it 3 times), so drive slowly when you're nearby. 
With a 4WD it should be easy to get there, with a campervan i wouldn't try it. We did it with a combi family car but it was really really close and no fun. There are a lot of moskitos around.

name: Scenic parking/rest area
description: Didn’t stay overnight but is a nice scenic place to stop for a break next to the lake. Spent a quiet night with spectacular northern lights here.

name: Oksfjordhamn Harbour
description: Parking on the very large car park area at the  Harbour. Beautiful view of the Fjord and Harbour. There is an overnight fee of 100NOK or 150NOK if electric hook up is needed.

name: camping spot next to service area by the national road
description:
Right next to the road there is a service area with toilet and sink (No water in sink). There are also 6 tables for dining and trash cans. 
There is a car path that leads to the woods and 30m in you can find the most perfect spot to set up the tent right next to your car. You have absolute privacy, with close distance to the toilet and tables at the service area

name: Sommarøy Marina
description: Campground with electricity, water and dump station.

name: Dunes of Neiden
description:
Sandy area with space for up to 6 Rigs (under 6m), to access 4WD is only needed if the weather is bad. 

The Land is inhabited by Reindeers so don't leave your Trash behind. Also don't make a Fire on the Ground, use a Grill.

name: Arctic-Lyngen
description: Beautiful camping with hot tub a great view on the fjord

name: Senjatrollit visitor centre
description: The biggest Troll in the world! Also has an area where you can empty your tanks and fill up with fresh water.

name: Hammerstad Camping
description: A nice little camp ground on the water front. Room for about 8 - 10 motorhomes.

name: Skagen Camping
description: A large open plan camping ground on the huge beautiful white sand beach

name: Lodingen harbour
description: Great place with very good showers and WiFi

name: Close to the glacier Kjenndalsbreen
description: This spot i situated on the toll road (small road to the Kjenndalsbreen glacier - 40 Krones). Nice place next ro the river with fire pits. Only noise is from the glacier river ;) No facilities.

name: Alesund by the sea
description: Big parking lot next to a small Football Stadion with view to the sea. The spot is in the suburbs of Alesund, right behind some family homes. There is a small road leading through the neighborhood so big rigs won't fit.  Drive to the city center 6 km. Very calm at night. No facilities.

name: Nice spot on the Lake
description: Nice spot with a view to the lake. Fire pits and sheep nearby 😎. Next to the road (191) but very quiet at night. No facilities.

name: Gateway for hiking
description: Parking lot where you can start for a hike or spend the night. No facilities. It's forbidden to camp on the parking lots next to the beach but this one is o.k. We spent two nights here and walked up to Blahoa Mt. which was a perfect day hike (+/- 7h walking time) with an amazing view over all the surrounding mountains.

name: Lake Granasjoen
description: Nice spot next to lake Granasjoen. Very quiet even Rt. 512 is close. No facilities. Good for swiming but cold... Lots of space.

name: Near Dombas
description: Nice Place of the end of a dirt road direct at a little river.On the way chance to see moose.

name: Årdal
description: Small patch of mixed gravel and grass by the waterfront.

name: Spot with lake view
description: Peaceful spot between the lake and the road. Very nice not very noisy even the road is nearby. Good for a swim or fishing. No facilities.

name: Spot in the woods
description:
Open spot in the middle of the forest where the sun can get trough.
 Close to E6 but very quiet. Forest road, you don't need  4x4 but bumpy. 
Not for the 'white RV's'. Follow the road up the hill until dead end. No facilities.

name: On the hills of Mo i Rama (Bertelberg)
description: Some nice spots when you drive up Bertelberg from Mo i Rama. From the top of Bertelberg you have a nice view over the city. Very quiet at night and very peaceful. No facilities.

name: Fantastic spot with a view
description: Perfect spot next to the sea with great view to the mountains. Beautiful spot to see the sunset or the northern lights. A bit rocky, you're better off with 4x4. The gravel road is very narrow. Small vans are ok. No facilities. Very peaceful and not crowded.

name: Beautiful campground next to the Fjord
description: Nice campground situated next to the fjord. if you need a nice hot shower or get your clothes washed... They have also cabins for rent. Toilet, hot shower, kitchen, washer, dryer.... all there. Very clean facilities. 200 Nok/2 P. washer 50 Nok, dryer 50 Nok, Wifi free

name: Mountain trail wild camp
description: Up a well used track to hiking paths, there are a couple of flat pull outs where you can camp.  Not far off the main road. Some road noise but not much. Didn’t see anyone else here on a Sunday in September. Good Telenor LTE signal.

name: Lakeside off toll road
description: There’s a toll of 40 NOK (payable with a credit card at an unmanned toll gate) to drive on the gravel road to access this site. There are many cabins in the area. This site is very private, however, with a beautiful view of a lake. The gravel road has little traffic, so it’s a quiet spot. No cell signal here.

name: Gravel by the fjord
description: Big patch of gravel, some parts covered with grass

name: Marina
description: Parking lot that can fit around 6 RVs. Hot showers, washer/dryer, fresh water and wifi. 150 NOK pay by envelope.

name: Bergen
description: Parking lot, there were a lot of RVs here when we arrived on a rainy day. Electricity, water and a dump station. All we were looking for was a dump so we didn't stay. 150 NOK/night. Near the light rail, 20 minutes into the city.

name: Street Parking
description: Parking in Bergen is tough, we found a row to park in along a football field behind a grocery store and metro line. It's not pretty but it's flat and free. A small RV also parked next to us. The metro into the city is right out front, 15 minutes to the center.     Maximum parking is 2 hours

name: Boyum Camping
description: Established campground, small shop. Right behind the museum. You can rent bikes.  Park wherever. Showers and laundry available for a fee. There are also cabins. Great views but the site itself is nothing special. Electricity, dump and water.

name: Bola Camp Ground
description: Parking lot with electricity along the sea a short walk from the center 25NOK/hour or 250 for 24. We paid for an hour dumped our loo, filled up our water and used their SUPER hot showers. There's also a propane exchange machine.

name: Overnight spot on the port
description: Quiet spot next to a small port. Off feom the main road. No facilities.

name: Polar Park arctic wildlife
description:
Provides several spots with and w/o hookups and one shower (no restrooms overnight). Bit off E6 and quiet!
Paid 250 NOK( around 26 Euros) for one night with power and an endless long hot shower. The fee can be paid in person during opening hours of the park or 24/7 at the kiosk electronically with a credit card.

name: Secret Waterfall Campsite
description: Nice spot next to a huge Waterfall. Step way 50m check it out before you drive down.

name: Fjord View Bum Fire Place
description: Next to E6 a small hidden way with lots of Wood for fire. Awesome View!!

name: Ulefoss in Telemark
description: Nice place by the water too pitch your tent.

name: Grubesand beach
description: 24 hour, free parking right by the beach. Open outdoor toilet.

name: Goksjø parking
description: Parking space by Goksjø, lot's of trails and two survival shelters nearby.

name: Goksjø turistforening
description: Parking by the water. Places to make bonfires.

name: Free Shower Hammerfest
description: In the passanger terminal are free toilets and showers. Open 5-18. After that time you have to call a guard. Also open in winter!

name: Cirkle K shower
description: Cirkle K gas station with clean shower. 40 NOK.

name: Riverside wild camp
description:
Nice grassy area right next to the river, with some trees to provide privacy from the road, which is quite busy during the early evening but quiet at night. No facilities, please keep the area clean (as it is now). Space for multiple vehicles and tents.
Keep an eye out for the exit of the road which is unmarked.

name: Knuten
description: On top of the mountain Knuten, 110 meters in elevation, there is some flat patches with amazing views all the way out to sea and down mefjorden. Absolutely stunning and worth carrying all your gear up!!

name: Countryside spot
description:
We took a dirt countryroad to the right, crossed a little wooden bridge and found a spot next to the road in a curve, where we could easily park the car and set up our tent. 
The road continues even further but is pretty overgrown. Some motorcycle riders past us and took a spot nearby (I guess even on the dirtroad). It's not the most idylic spot after passing Geiranger, but it's a good alternative for the fully booked and expensive campings nearby.

name: Walking tracks car park
description: Gravel car park for local walking tracks

name: Gravel parking area
description: Gravel Parking area near Fjord. Fjord is a 2 minute walk. Note access is by following the road that parallels the highway. The other end of the road is marked "Private road"

name: Utakliev Beach
description:
From Haukland coming pass the tunel. Then turn left. Space for up to 6 Camping Cars. Larger rigs possible. Off Season free. During season to be paied at the ticket machine. Dont know the price during the Season. Toilets are closed off season. 
Located Kust behind the dunes. Only few meters to the beatifull beach. One of the moste adorable beaches.

name: Roadside rest area
description: Rest area just off the road. Toilets closed in winter

name: Rest Area
description:
Roadside Picnic spot, no sign re no camping.
Toilets closed in Winter until 15th May

name: hamnigberg
description: parking area wih a great view on the sea

name: Camp spot by a lake
description: Quiet place by a lake. A little trail in to the woods. Far enough to not hear the road. Easy 4x4 access.

name: Øksne
description: Gravel-road of the main road. Easy 4x4 access

name: Livdtun Kafe
description: Cafe & restaurant serving coffee , cake & lunch. Lovely surroundings run by a South African Lady.

name: Rystad Camping
description: Small, well maintained and clean. Very quiet. Beach access.

name: Neiden
description: level parking. Quiet with a field in front. near an abandomed hotel.

name: The harbour
description: This is a practical parking place for a night or two.  In our case it was 2 nights while we waited to enter Russia. There is a dump station for grey and black water as well as drinking water, but these are only open in the summer.  It is 400m to 2 supermarkets and 1km to the town center.  The Hurtigruten ship docks 300m from here. There is a vet closeby.

name: Indre-Folda
description: Small strip of land directly at water . Access is via a small track from  route 17. Very tranquil at night & great spot for fishing. Access could be a problem for high  or wide vehicle.

name: Tosbotn
description: Gravel tracks into Forest that go up to a newly constructed hydroelectric plant. This place is beside the river & very quiet when we were here. Lots of possibilities to park in this area for a night.

name: Ushaped sideroad with multiple camping options
description:
As said in title: u shaped side road. Multiple spots available. Small stream nearby(filled end of may, don't know about summertime
Very quite place to spend the night

name: Camp spot near dam
description: Several small lots where you can park a small rv, buscamper or car with rooftoptent. Drinkable water very nearby, as you can drink most ‘wild’ water here.

name: Sognefjellet Mountain Camp
description:
Just aside the main Road 55 pass the Parking Lot with the Tourist Busses and proceed on the Dirt Road into the wild. 

We were completly alone just passed by a 4x4 Sprinter in the morning. 
Being a mountain its juite windy and can be cold. But the view on the Glacier and the mountains makes up for that.

name: Rossaga Mountain Plateau
description:
Plenty of space for multiple Rigs and juite awesome views.
The gate at the entrance can be opened to get to the Spot. If you have doubt ask the friendly owners of the house nearby. We asked them too and they were fine with it. 

We didnt stay here since it was raining but with nice weather it will be an awesome spot.

name: Fv868 Pullout Camp
description:
Just a Standart Pullout aside the Street. But, there is a ladder leading to a small "garden" above. Quite cool for one night. 
The view on the water also is awesome.
Not Pet friendly due to the Street nearby.

name: Julaidanjavri Mountain Camp
description: Even the way up here is spectacular. And then you arrive on a Mounain with noone around. Your completly alone here. Space for 1-2 Rigs.

name: Town parking by the fjords of Sæbø
description:
Public parking by the bay, beautiful view, very quiet as the road leads to a dead end.

There's a public park 12 meters from the parking with 2 clean bathrooms, picnic tables, a fire pit, a wood oven, a slack line, a volley ball net and a horseshoe game!

Fantastic spot!!

name: Klubben
description: Very nice spot by a beach, room for 1 vehicle, couple of tents, need 4x4 to drive down from main road.

name: Sauda next to camper service station
description: A place next to the Fjord and two little huts. A little noisy from the harbour workers. Nice view to the mountain.

name: Eidfjord camping
description: Nice camping directly in the village with places by the water. Beautiful views.

name: Kvenvik - road may be closed at times
description: Camping by lake, scenic and protected... entrance from north may be closed at times due to reindeer husbandry. Be cautious.

name: Vestre Jakobselv Camping
description: Campingground, huts for rent, inexpensive. Easy access, clean.

name: Buar Glacier Parking + Overnight
description:
Trailhead parking of hike to Buar/Buer Glacier in Folgefonna National park. Fee:150 NOK. No amenities at the moment (OSM maps show a restroom, but there is none). River provides water though. You can stay overnight, there is space for around 25 campers. You can see the glacier from the camp.
There is a very large and relatively level patch of grass as well, you could probably pitch a tent there. I didn't see any though, so I'm not sure.

name: Odda Free Drinking Water + Dump Station
description: Free drinking water from a hose as well as a place to dump grey water - in Odda (next to the central bus station and the harbour)

name: Knott Trailhead
description:
This trail head parking for some small trails along the coast can fit 2-3 campers and is located in a very rural area, very quiet. The road is quite narrow at times, so I'm not sure about big rigs. No amenities.

One of the badly marked trails leads you on top of a hill ("Knott") from where you have a nice view on all the surrounding islands / peninsulas.

name: Osoyro harbour camper place
description: Very nice camper parking, quiet, with nice view. Electricity, hot shower and toilette dump and drinking water at Essostation on the main road. (Road crossing). You can also pay the parking for the night there). Otherwise Payment by credit card online st the parking. 150 Kr without shower (electricity included).

name: Ifjord Camping & Accommodation
description:
Good Camping, very good showers and washing machines!
Also brilliant fishing spot!

name: Karasjok
description: Dumping station and water to refil  2 kn from the town.

name: Lyngen alps view
description: Small place for 1-3 overlanders. There is a magnificient view of lyngenalps (when good weather - not our case so no picture). There is a small walk around to panoramic view. There is also a bench and table to rest. Not bad for one night as its far from the main road and no traffic.

name: Spåkenes costal fort
description: War fort above the fjord with great views. Nice place for overnight. Even in peak season no people around. Small parking space for max 3 overlanders, but further is more space. Approach road a bit bumpy, but we reached with camper with terrible clearance without problem. Very quiet place

name: Kvisvik Camping
description: Nice camping off the main road. Many annual caravans but for day users best places down at the fjord with nice view. 200 Nkr for 2 pers+4x4.

name: Adventure Camp
description: Just a camper spot near the harbour. Nice view

name: Holm camping
description: Very nice camping. Nice views on the fjord. Very nice kitchen where you can eat. It’s an old school house . There are rooms at 650 Kr, huts for 450 Kr. Camping 230 Kr. You can do some nice walks. Washing machine and dryer.

name: Laukvik fish drying field
description: Next to the fish factory at the edge of the sea nearby of fish drying structures. The smell was not that bad :). Private and quiet place for night ok.

name: Kjellingstraumen
description:
*Seasonal Closures*

Very nice but small campsite,. Good for laundry and very hot showers.

name: Valldal Camping
description: pretty spot at a warmer elevation than the pass. lovely camping near the river.

name: Sorvagen pier
description: Close to this place is a wave breaking pier which is good for sleeping. You have sea from all sides and is far from people and other tourists.

name: Fiskvagvatnet
description: Normal parking good for one night stay. Starting point for trips around lake and other trails. Next to the road so expect some trafic and noise in the morning... not the best and idylic place.

name: Shower Mo i Rana
description: You can ask for shower at the petrol station. Good for hardcore overlanders avoiding campsites :)

name: Yttervik Camping
description: Nice camping with all facilities. cabins, tents and RV

name: Under the bridge of Sadnessjoen
description:
Big gravel place under the bridge. Road to go down gravel but good.
No services. Very little noise from the bridge. Nice views. Suiteable also for big rigs.

name: Skogmo family camping
description: Poor equipment's camping site. But cheap.

name: Eidsdal fjord view!!!
description:
Break from boring norwegian road side overnights! Get full of great spectacular view of the fjord directly from your bedroom window! On the top of the hill a parking place with dust bins and benches ideal fot night with your camper. Spectacular view guarantee and absolute silence and far away from people. Place for 10+ campers but we were alone that night. Also starting point for treks to close lake and hills with great views.
there is a sign: no camping allowed. might be ok for vehicles but definitely not for tents

name: Jostedalbreen parking
description: End of the scenic road parking. Starting point for a trip to the glacier. Parking for 10 hours 50NOK overnight 100NOK. Is next to the river with no extra views unfortunately. You can camp in a camping place nearby for double price, with showers and other amenities.

name: Korgen Camping AS
description: Quiet, very clean place. Great facilities, shower is 10 Kronen for 4 minutes. The kitchen is great with a cozy place to sit inside. Camping with a tent without electricity costs 220 Kronen. Dryer and Washing machine available, very close to E6, but very quite. Fishing grounds are at the camping place.Great facilities, one of the best kitchens we've seen. Camping is Kr200 per tent or Kr480 for a cabin which houses 4 people.

name: Risør (Laundromat, WC, Shower)
description: Open Laundry, WC and Showers pay with Nkr

name: Alta River Camping
description:
Nice and clean campground. You can rent huts as well.
Well equipped kitchen and laundry service.
4G available, electricity on all spots included.
There is another campground close-by

name: Liarvatnet
description: End of the road free parking next to the lake. 15km from Preikestolen where is absolutely no go for free camping. I think this place is nice when weather good. There is also some tent place nearby 200m but i don't know if paid or not. Anyway for campers here is plenty of space.

name: Skarberget - Bognes Ferry
description:
Skarberget - Bognes Ferry

184 NOK for car up to 6m and 2 persons. (20€).

name: Røldal Hyttegrend Camping & Caravanning
description:
Excellent value for money. Good kitchen, great lounge to sit in during bad weather. Small private campground with hot showers. Today we paid 170kr. Highly recommend! Friendly people. Open year round. 

Kyrkjevegen 49, 5760 Røldal, Norway

name: Local camping
description: good facilities but terrible mosquitoes.

name: Rysstad petrol station
description: A gas station where to get a water refill i suppose for free, or at least I took for free. You can also refill you gasoline tank of stomach with some fast food

name: Jondalselva
description: Place next to the amusement place... lake for swimming with pontone, playground for kids, beach and toilet. Unfortunately on the crossroad so the traffic is for Norway quite high and we were here 7 campers, some bikers so not the best place for privacy.There is a hardcore bikers club just over the road.

name: Byglandsfjord
description: Beautiful wild campsite direct at the fjord. Easy access, big rigs possible, good for 3 Defenders, fireplace, direct access to the water, no facilities

name: Kongsberg dumpit and watter it
description: Place to let your car relieve and you can dump grey and black watter too. You can also refill your water tank, but own pipe needed. All for free!

name: Glende Bridge Free Camp
description: Almost on the old bridge. Grassy. Some trees give a bit feeling of privacy although you are close to the main road. Quiet at night with the soothing sound of the river. Reasonable overnight spot.

name: Between Road And River Free Camp
description: Open spot directly on the river. Great view over the river. Not completely secluded but trees and bush between the spot and the mainroad give a good sensence of privacy. The mainroad is close by. Only 20 metres away. At night quiet. The entrance has low hanging but flexible branches. Easy for midsized vans. Also a great spot for bikers to pitch a tent.

name: Lone Camping
description: Great place for all weather. Nice camping by a lake. Lounge, kitchens, covered picnic tables to escape Bergen’s famous rain. Laundry facility and grocery store. Friendly staff and moderate price. Nice bathrooms and hot showers that are very clean.

name: Jolstraholmen Camping of Hytter
description: Charming site with beautiful rapids and surrounded by mountains. Price of 260 kr as of July 2019 which is reasonable in Norway. Fantastic facilities including a kitchen, laundry and impeccable washrooms. A place for children to play and new cabins. There is a gas station and a grocery store. One of the best sites on our motorcycling trip.

name: Naustelona
description: Beautiful wildcamp by fishingwater. Next to mountainroad with little traffic.

name: Larvik
description: Small parking in front of the beach, just outside the village

name: Vikafjell
description: Fantastic view, top of mountain about 930 m above sea.  Lot of space for more than 5 cars.

name: Gravel Area
description: nothing here but a big flat space directly underneath the road and next to the railroad. Good option if you are heading to Bergen

name: By the river
description: Nice riverside with high mountain on the road towards Nordfjordeid.

name: Tollevika
description: Nice place by the sea, public beach, trails nearby, easy access.

name: Javall kaj
description: An old quay. There is a loop at the end of the track where you in a line can place a convoy of vehicles. But it is just a couple of hundreds meters from a campsite so it might be good to keep a low profile. Possible to take a bath in the lake, but we won’t recommend drinking it with out filtering it first. The track is certainly not cleared at winters.

name: Near Alta Russeluft
description:
Location in the grass at the edge of the fjord.
You can make a fire place.
Acces by a sloping path.

name: sani Havoysund
description: a small sani station where you can empty the black and grey tanks. you can also fill water.

name: Uteplassen
description: Uteplassen Camping. Small spot for travellers, cheap, very friendly, great facilites. Sunny valley near the glaciers of Jostedalsbreen. Near E5, but very quiet in the evening.

name: Rest stop near Stranda
description: Rest stop with heated toilets und running water, river nearby and benches, five good places for one night, medium traffic from the road.

name: Fylkesweg
description: Nice Place for 1 or 2 Cars. Super nice view!

name: Moskenes Camping
description: Campsite near ferry station Big area but gets filled up early in summer and no reservations. Wi-Fi, kitchen, hot showers and restaurant on site but the nearest store is 2.5 km away. charging devices limited. Staff was friendly.

name: Spot with riverview
description: Small spot right next to the Road (E6). There‘s a picnic table and the view is amazing.

name: Lofoten
description: Nice place to put up a tent if you are on a bicycle, it's just off to bicycle route that goes along a tunnel. There is fresh water from a water fall. Toilets 800 m away on a rest place.

name: Brensholmvegen sommoroya parking
description: Nice place next to the bridge. there is a waste bin and a toilet. access at the sea. great views.

name: stedjeberet old rest area
description:
Old section of road closed off for cars but open for cyclists. Just next to a tunnel there is an old viewpoint/rest area with a bench. 

Excellent view of the fjord. Quiet and totally out of view from buildings or traffic.

name: Lake near Trofors
description:
Beautiful place right @ the Lake with fireplace.
Great view over the Lake.

name: Mefjordvaer
description: a flat parking place with beautiful views over the mountains and fjord. Their is a garbage disposal , a toilet and a bbq house.

name: Riverside
description:
Beautiful large location facing large cliffs 90° around you. Possibility of random sheep. Nearby river and bridge.
Internet 4G.

name: Ersfjord pier
description: a grass area next to the pier. here you have a beautiful view over the fjord.

name: Krogstadtunet Camping
description:
Krogstadtunet Camping

Very nice farm-like setting with grassy pitches, clean heated bathrooms, small functional kitchen, fire pit, dump station, cottages, playground. Very friendly owners, plentiful amenities and reasonable prices make this a great value!
200 nok with electric, 180 nok without

name: Badeplass Mjelkevika
description: At the end of a road close to museum Hordamuseet, there is a level quay which will fit 4-5 campers. This is also a swimspot with springboards, some tables and so on. Toilets are available at the museum, ca. 100m away. Locals also come here to fish.

name: Nesvatnet reststop
description:
Reststop with a few benches, bins and grassy area. Placed next to the road but on a small hill so, semi protected from view. 

It's next ti the lake but it might be difficult to access. 

A truck driver were resting here when I visited. 

Didn't stay but it looked good enough for me.

name: Skaland
description:
a quiet parking place behind the supermarket.
With a beautiful view over de small harbor and the surrounding mountains.
The walk to the husfjellet top starts here.

name: Near Stave
description: A beautiful place in the middle of a meadow with a nice view over the Atlantic ocean.

name: A grass spot next to the ocean
description: a beautiful spot next to the ocean with a magnificant view of  the fjord. It is here very quiet . The road to the campsite is a dirt road with putholes but okay.

name: Eidsvatnet
description: Nice place right next to the lake to park a car and set a tent. Sadly next to the street. Toilet 500m.

name: Bonnies Camp
description:
next to the rarely used road, next to a little  waterfall. Good spot, no shade. More spots along the road, most little and right next to  it. 
(toll road 60Nok, only by credit card)

name: Lom Campsite
description: Nice little Campsite near Jotunheimen Nationalpark. You can build up a tent beside your car, come with an Caravan or build up just a tent alone. There's a little outdoor kitchen were you can cook. electricity can be booked seperately. shower costs you 10nok for five minutes (and these showers are amazing! never had such great showers on a campsite)

name: Stamnes
description: A grass path next to the fjord. With a beautiful view.

name: Sigerfjord
description: A sani station where you dump gray and black water and fill drinking water.

name: myrksdal valley near fresh water
description: Nice spot some 200 m walk from small parking spot. walk down towards the  river. some cars but not many. chance of random cows. Nice though!

name: Easy and Large Wildcamping
description: There is plenty of parking space for Mobile Homes / Campers. Also for cars ofcourse. Next to these spaces is a big field with wild grass. We spent the night with 3 tents and a van. There might be sheep walking around.

name: Våvatnet not-so-quiet but beautiful
description:
There is a rest stop by the side of the road. That's as far as campers will get on this one. 

Bikers and hikers may take a blocked of path just before the stop, down to an graveled area and boatyard. I think would be possible to pitch there but if you have the energy I recommend walking a bit further out along the beach. 

If you walk with the lake on your left hand side about 150m you'll find the firepit, planed area to put your tent and good vibes that I left for you. 

Enjoy.

name: Oppmyre camping
description:
campground for tent and motorhomes.
Beautiful view of the fjord and the surrounding mountains.
Very clean toilets and showers.

name: Lifjordbotn
description:
a peacefull place at the edge of the fjord.
with benches and fireplaces.

name: Nice camping place by the water
description: You can stay here with an Mobile Home / Camper, but also with a car and tents. We spend the night here with 3 tents. There is a river next to the place, and the road is not busy.

name: Gruneholen / Harefosshole - grassy spot at waterfall
description: Nice place to camp at a waterfall. There is a car park, walk down and take a right. 2 min walk from the car there is a grassy spot for a small to medium tent.

name: Place next to a river
description:
This place is along the road 13. its up the mountain but in a windshadow. Its next to a river. There is not much traffic on the road. Its a quiet place.
Close to the street the ground is graveld and further away there is grass.

name: Mountain view
description:
Nice quite place for one campingcar.
Next to a forest where you might see moose.
Ground is gravel and even.

name: Spot with nice view
description: It is a spot next to the road of Nyksund but in the evening their is almost no traffic. You have a beautiful view over the ocean.

name: Lundhøgda Camping and Motel
description: Standard RV park. 220 nok includes electric. 10 nok showers. laundry and sauna available

name: Sani Station - Myre
description: Here you can dump your black and gray water and you can fill the water tank. It cost NOK 30 and you pay it at the gas station The height of the roof is around 3.80 meters.

name: Nykvag - Camping
description:
A camp place at the small harbor of Nyksvåg. 
it is on a small parking lot.

name: Picnic place with toilets
description: Start of some nice hikes. Picnic tables, pit toilets, at little lane with nice view.

name: Gjeilo Camping
description:
150Nok basic price, 20Nok/person, 5Nok 4min shower, 30Nok big washing mashine, 30Nok dryer. very slow internet. otherwise friendly reception and fairly nice place. Enough space and picknik tabkes.Everything is clean. It's  an option. Cabins available 400Nok, also electricity 30Nok. Little kitchen and common  room. 
Feels overpriced given that  nothing is  included. But this is very common  on  Notwegian and Swedisch campgrounds.
Also 2 showers each for the whole place is not enough in my opinion. This also seems very common  in Norway

name: Hoysand Free Camp
description: Parkingspots along the coastal road. Also known as camper stellplatz. Free. No ameneties. Quite a few overnighters here. Pretty quiet. Only some anglers leave late in the evening and arrive early in the morning. When it's beach weather the locals fill up the parking spots quickly. Late afternoon / early evening most of them leave. The bitumen road is dead-end and has not that much space to turn when it's busy. Maybe check that out first before you go in.

name: Søberg
description: A very quiet standing place at a beautiful beach. Almost no visitors. Their is a bench and a garbage bin.

name: Hovden
description: A nice spot overviewing the sea. Here are various hiking trails through the beautiful nature

name: Nedstrand Feriesenter
description:
Close to Nedstrand, follow sign to campsite all the way to the marina. 150nok per night. Toilet and shower. 10nok per shower. Electricity available. 10 A. 
Fantastic seaside view.

name: Hervik Camping
description: Nice campsite. Drive all the way to the marina. Find you a place and pay 200nok in the kiosk between 17-18 and 14-15 on Sunday. Fantastic view. All facilities. Telephone number at enterance.

name: Bobilparkering/Campervan parking.
description: Municipal campervan parking. New established. 12 places.

name: Sør-Randalen
description: One of several possible camp spots along this mountain road. Nice and narrow gravel road. A bit rough and eroded here and there so do not bring your caravan or euro camper up here.

name: Besseggen Fjellpark
description: A nice camping ground, besides the river. 5 minute drive to Gjendesheim for the walk to Besseggen (and more).

name: Storavik
description: A place on a parking lot near a very quiet road. if you are Lucky here you can see sea eagles

name: Furuly Camping
description: standard campsite. Parking on grass. Small kitchen area and pay (10 nok) showers. 185 nok/night or 220 nok with electric

name: Trollkyrka Parking
description:
just a parking lot and a full one. If you have other options use them, if not Ok for the night. No toilets, bushes are full of toilet paper, please take that stuff with you to the trash. It's so much more pleasant for  everybody. 
Hike is about two hours uphill, not too easy. Cave is 70m long, no light inside and slipery. It's  not really for dogs or small kids. Even if you carry them it might be difficult. There is a second chamber you  can  access from  the outside over a ladder.

name: Breivikeidet
description: Several wild camp spots near a sand road/track.

name: Laundry & shower at marina
description: Service room next to Kayak store. You have to pay per App "Gomarina" and enter a pin they give you for every service.  Available:  2 washing machines 25 Nok, 2 dryer for 25 Nok, 4 showers 25 Nok. Entry to service room 40 Nok - maybe you dont need it if you pay directly per washing machine. All working and Ok. Parking 25Nok/hour, free from 18.00 o' clock

name: Fjordgløtt camping
description: Nice terraced campsite on grass by the river. 40 NOK for a camper van with 4 adults.

name: Lakeside Rest Stop
description: Large parking area with heated restroom, hot water, picnic tables. Next to a lake. Very little road noise. Good for a night.

name: Grunnfør
description: A place next to the ocean with a open view. their is here also a little cottage that you can use. with a wood stove, table and chairs and also a guitar.

name: Melbu service station
description: Free service station in the parking lot of rema 1000.  You can empty black and gray water and fill fresh water.

name: Campsite at the Fjord
description: There is a good parkingplace. A few meters away is a Waterfall, the Fjord and some bench with a Fireplace. The view is wondefull and stuning from this place. Come and see.

name: Campspot on the Mountain
description: You drive a litte serpentine road to the his end. There is a parking place. Before you reach parking place the are also a few parking bays. There is a stuning few and a womderfull Mountain river a few meters from the road.

name: Sandoya
description: A beautiful spot in the middle of nature with a 360 degrees view. It is a dirth road towards the spot.

name: Vagan
description: A nice  place where you park on grass pitches. You have a beautiful view over the bay. There start here a walking trial to the top of holandsmaelen.

name: Circle K petrol station
description:
Nice hot shower for 50Nok. Key at fast-food place. Please keep the place clean, and don't  abuse it, so they still offer it. 
Petrol station, fast food place, super market.

name: Saltdal free water
description: free drinking water available. hose available.  brown water disposal (only canister), toilets , picknick  area (some with rain cover), trash. I guess you  could  spend a night here

name: Stave camping
description: Camping with campsite for tents and campers at the beach. Nice views. Also little cabines available. Its possible to book a jacuzzi for 500 NOK.

name: Ski jump tower Oslo
description: Large parking lot not far from the Ski jump tower. No services, stayed here for a couple of nights no worries.

name: Bridge in Norway
description: Beautiful plays to chill if you like to camp but there is a problem there is a water near by so there are mosquitoes so but it’s a cozy place

name: Great spot
description: Great spot on the water, no services, rubbish bins only. Great for fishing and swimming, we caught some nice fish for dinner.

name: Sandsletta Camping
description: Big camping at a lake with pitches for tents, camper and caravans. Some pitches are situated right at the lake, with a nice view. Also different kinds of cabines available. There is a restaurant, a small shop, a sauna (broken when we were there), warm and dry place to sit and u can use boats for free. Shower costs 10 NOK. There is also wasmachine and dryer.

name: Gravel place besides road
description: Just a little space by the road where you can park your car. Nothing fancy around, but the road is quite calm so it is okay to stay there for one night.

name: Shower at Nærbutikken Tufsingdal
description: Clean toilet and shower (10 NOK for 3 minutes). There is also a gas station and a grocery shop. You can get rid of your waste, fill up your water and have a break. Please note, that camping is not allowed.

name: Shower at Hjerkinnhus Hotell
description: At the hotel are public showers available (50 NOK). If you are not resident in the hotel, you pay at the reception. The showers are located in the basement where the toilets are.

name: Shower and toilets at Vassbygdi Servicebygg
description: Free toilet, shower (10 NOK for 3 min), parking and a small shop. Camping is not allowed.

name: Ålvikveien informal camping space
description:
6/22 - This place is currently closed due to construction work

A parking lot for about 6-8 campervans. Tables, trash bins and toilet available, next to the water.

name: Landskapspark Herand
description: Nice parking space by the water. There is a small kiosk and also a restaurant on the other side of the street. Access to clean toilet, shower (30 NOK for 8 min), washing machine and dryer. For overnight parking you pay at the kiosk and put the receipt in the window.

name: View point
description: Great place overlooking the fjord and watching the cruise ships go past. This place is quiet at night only the odd car going past. There are no services only rubbish bins. We had a good night here.

name: Trysil Hyttegrend & Camping
description: Nice little campground next to the river. Clean and modern sanitary and a lot of additional stuff free of charge (sauna, bbq etc) and a nice playground for kids. Next to the road, but still pretty calm.

name: Askevågen gravel field
description:
Small gravel field near to the coast and the viewpoint but surrounded on 3 sides by rocks, so nice and out of the wind.

Best for single overnight stay.

name: Hestvika
description:
Just a small pullout right next to the road. But with a beautiful sunset view and good 4g connection. 

Went here instead of the other spot nearby since there was no afternoon sun but here there is.

name: Gigantic view on top of the fell
description: Flat spot next to the street with wonderful view over the fell. Lots of creeks and lakes (fresh water!) around. Good for 2-3 vehicles. Very quiet during the night. Fast mobile internet. Access road restricted to vehicles < 10 m, narrow curves. If you drive further to Lærdal you will find more overnight spots just along the road.

name: Near the river
description: Nice spot near the river. Calm and beautiful view to an open field and the forest. Little fireplace.

name: Sleep and Waterplace
description: This place has some trees and bushes which protect a little from wind. Many fireplaces. Close to the coordinates is a little stream 5m between the bushes. At the end easy to turn.

name: Lake Gálggojávri
description: A gravel road brings you to several camp pitches near the lake. It is here very quiet. Large trucks can come here.

name: Lyngenfjord Mountain Road
description:
last pullout before you lose 4g phone connection, with a beautiful view down the valley

the road up is the main attraction, and if you don't mind having no 4g I highly advise you keep driving another 10+km for even better views.

the road does not require a 4x4, but you do need some solid suspension. There are a lot of potholes.

name: Ferda avd. Ålesund
description: They sell campers here but they also have a workshop and a store with a lot of equipment. Came here with a broken water pump. They had the pump and borrowed me the tools I needed. Great service!

name: Pullout
description: not the nicest place,  just a pullout between the bushes. Quite a bit of garbage  around, please at least do not add to it.  It's  hard to find a place in this  area,  it's  pretty populated. Big enough for one van comfortably (two or three if you are friends).

name: Senja
description: Great place on parking with stunning view

name: Along the river
description: Little spot on the calm river. Private but open gravel road. A bit uneven and rough, so not for tents I guess. But very quiet and peaceful

name: Next to the bridge
description: Small bay on a side street right after a little bridge. No traffic at all. However, the place is just next to a torrent. For someone who does not mind the constant noise of the water, a really nice place to stay. The place is quite rough and a bit sloping but we liked it. Not suitable for tents I guess. Some more places upstream on the little private road.

name: Seaview Smørfjord
description:
Spot just of the E69 to Nordkapp, perfect for an overnight. some cars pass by but not too noticable. 

Solid 4g signal

name: Hestbrinken
description: stunningly beautiful, lots of room, next to the river, with benches and fireplace. This place is well away from the road, therefore it's very quiet. We stayed here for a couple of nights for total relaxation. There is also a petrol station and small shop 1km up the road.

name: On the Edge of the village
description: Little gravel spot next to some garages at the edge of the little village. Beyond the dike with some benches.

name: Next to the river
description: This is another fantastic spot, great for a couple of nights. This place is very private and shielded from the road. We could see that people before us had a spot for a camp fire. Nice walks along the river to a waterfall at the lower end. This place is very clean, don't leave any rubbish.

name: Spot near Borre
description: Nice spot after arrival with ferry at Horten. It's not directly at the water, but near. Toilets may be available through Borre Campsite Season (1st May - 1st October) or ask at Steinbrygga habor.

name: Bonnies forest camp
description: Nice flat space in the forest, pit toilets, one fire place and one table.

name: Ellis Camp
description: Just a flat area next to the road. With one hidden picknick table and little camping spot. Lots of space. Next to the official hiking parking which is a 100m ahead, and which is also a very good spot for camping, with lots of space and toilets. It was busy when we got there, thats why we prefered this place.

name: Quiet overnight spot
description: Large overnight spot also close to the E6 it is quiet at night. There are a few places were people before us had a fire. No Services.

name: very quiet overnighter
description: Very quiet, well away from the road. You can camp close to the water if you like or up higher as we did.

name: water & shower
description: Shell petrol station  offers shower for 50Nok. Nice and clean.  Also some water  hose - outside npt so official but you can  ask for the key. worked for  us.

name: Leika place
description: picnic site with tables and rain shelter. toilets available. lots of space

name: A*Salteriet hostel
description: Located at beautiful  *A Tofoten islands.  nice scenery around. polite reception staff speak good English. clean room

name: Ulsberg wild camp uphill
description:
On this gravel road after you leave the houses behind you you can park on several places next to the road. 
Nothing their but trees, view and a creek. 
The big white motorhomes won’t fit. 

Pictures are taken on different park possibilities along this that ens gravel road.

name: Brønnøysund
description:
A very quiet parking lot is available for 42 hour parking. From here it is a nice toen walk to the restaurants and shops. The view from the parking lot over the sea is great.
It is not a campsite but camping is allowed.

name: Glacierview at Holandsfjord
description:
Parking lot next to the FV17. It has a great view on the Glacier. 
The parking is 200 meters long and the road has no traffic during the night. 
Unique spot!

name: Kviltorp camping
description: by the coast at Molde, smallest cabin rate 600kn. hot shower needs to pay extra 20kn. public kitchen but lack forks n spoons. toilet is walking distance

name: Tromsø Bellvik Northernlight
description: On this hill is a great spot to spent the night. We saw the Northern light very clear.

name: Riverside
description: Nice Parking on the River. Tables, garbage. ok.

name: Amongst Fisher Houses
description: Nice Place at the sea.ferries Passing to the Islands.nice Picknick Place with table and Bank.

name: Unknown Parking
description: A Place away from the E6.i was Aline for O’Neill on twostepp Nights perfekt.no Service.beach away 60m.

name: Tvliet
description: Parking in de front of a church. Very quiet. Only a parking .

name: Fjord view spot
description: Spot is beside the parking next to road E6. Easy access by car, beautiful view, good for tents and small/medium vans. Place with fireplace and place to sit.

name: Rest area
description: Rest area with toilets. Beautiful huts with fireplace and fjord view. Place for fishing also available. Also possible place for a bit private.

name: Quiet stay by lake
description: The spot is just beside the bridge on the left hand side. Area is large enough to fit quite many cars and rigs. Easy access to lake, fireplace together with place to sit. Nice area and view. There is a camping very close to the spot.

name: Easy access to Narvik
description: Place is next to the Veteranplassen. Nice view of the bridge. Access to water, fishing spot together with fireplace.

name: Esso
description: Esso Petrol Station with fresh drinking water and dumping station for free.

name: Nordmela
description: Parking area behind an old community center offers 4 - 6 spots for RVs. Past the yard is a large fire pit behind of which you can go a little further to camp directly at a sandy beach. 4WD recommended.

name: Kabelvag Camping
description: Very nice place at a lake . You can hike a lot in the lake area. They ve a small store offering drinks and food. Sanitary is top cleaned ! Kitchen place clean. Were you can sit also . It’s Open 24/7 all over the year ! Winter Camping also

name: Sport & Fritids Stua
description: A very charming little store owend by av lokal. There you will finde camping equipment, clothes, fishing equipment and even beautifull pictures taken by the owner. You can find the store on facebook - Sport & Fritids Stua.

name: Lovely Sunset campsite
description: Flat grassy square by the fjord. Good for 2 tents or just to enjoy the sunset. Parking place 50m up. You can't drive down by car, but still nice place just for dinner, and you sleep on the parking. Really quiet road.

name: Marina Parking & Campsite
description:
Small and simple camping with all facilities. No staff, you have to pay 250nok with Vipps.
We just stop for a hot shower.

name: Åkrafjorden old road
description:
Wild camping next to the old road, with scenic view of Åkra and Åkrafjorden. Very little traffic.

A few kilometers away you can bungee jump from Trolljuv bru!!

Enough space for a handful of camper vans and tents. (More space for small tents down a little hill from the road)

(There might be sheep roaming, so don’t let pets roam free)

Running stream a short walk away. Other than that no facilities other than the amazing view.

name: Wild camp a few km from the main road number 29
description: Take the gravel road up in the mountain and keep right, and at the end you'll find a turning spot

name: Kråka parking lot
description: Parking lot with access to good WC. The lot is easely available and close to both the main road and the waterfront. Expect some traffic noise.

name: Tromøya beach
description:
Nice space on a pebble/boulder beach, with numerous sites for both vehicles and tents, varying from open to 100% sheltered between trees.

Very clean (please keep it that way! Bring your trash), and when we were here we shared with another van.

name: Along road 3788
description: Quiet camp in the woods. Just trees around i a clearing

name: Røgle
description: wery nice gravel road and it is steep. was little bit tricky whit only 2x4. place is close to something called eventyrskogen. (adventure  forest) it is a parking lot that holds up to 5-10 overlanders

name: Nice sunny spot
description: Located next to a gravel road in the forrest. There is a fire pit and no others in sight. 50m from the river.

name: Camp at old harbour with a view
description: A very nice campsite with a stunning view to the Geiranger fjord. The harbour is not in use anymore. There's very quiet and also room for bigger rigs. The road down is in good condition.

name: Along the Fjord
description: Near the entrance of the Tunnel, following the old Road, you find a lot of places for campervans. The ground is stony

name: Nice parkingplace near a lake
description: Nice parking Place. Near a lake. Lot of Place also for tents. WC(Pay), dump plus fresh water.sitting places

name: Parking Place in the Nothing
description: On this Route you find only a few places to stand overnight. Therfore you may be happy to stay Here. Nice view over the Fjord. And nothing else. 3 rendeers passed the van in Night.

name: Parking Place
description: Nice Parking Place with nice view over the Fjord. Sitting places. Nothing Else. For one Night

name: Fisherman's Camp
description:
Free Campground for fisherman.
Lokal tells me: it's OK

name: Varjikat Camping
description: Nice grassy campsite next to the beach/fjord.

name: Wild camp close to Tretten
description:
A small dam close to the small village called Tretten on the E6 highway.
A toll road, cost about 50NOK, leads up to the mountains where there are several places to visit and hike. Many wild camps to be found, but this is only one of them. Friendly cows roam freely here, so be kind to them and do not feed them.
(Road might be closed durning winter seasons)

name: Fjord pulles
description: Old farm house not used any more, direct at the fjord. Very nice quiet.

name: Near a rafting place
description: Great meadow. Nearby you find an organisation which offers rafting. WC is also here.

name: Kvennvika Beach
description: Great campsite by the beach. Easy access and with facilities like toilets. Perfect for setting up tent and have a late night swim.

name: Fiplingvatnet
description: Beautiful spot by the water. Great for several nights stay, with fishing and swimming.

name: Fjord near ferry to Anderness
description: Take the path up and on second plateau nice free camping 4x4 only. Small trucks

name: Andoya aknes
description: Right on the Fjord nice and calm. Gras underground little climbing in to the Fjord only 4x4

name: Bofjord
description: Old house on the shore. Nice free camp for 4x4 only. Good fishing spot.

name: Straumsholmen parking
description:
