P













































Parking lot with great view to the ocean. Nice place for both tent camping and motorhomes. There is a parking/camping fee (NOK 250), which includes access to toilets, shower and dumpsters.

name: Dovrefjell view next to the river
description: Wild camp near Dovrefjell national park. Great view on the mountains and valley. Close to the river. Several places on sort of terraces, but enough room to feel alone.

name: gravel pit-wind protected
description: Huge garvel pit area with multiple places to set up camp. Some with good wind protection,some with fiord view. its away from the street.

name: Breivika Campspot
description: Wonderful beach at the foot og the great Dønnamannen mountain. Tenting or campervan/RV. Few van-sites, but lots of space for tenting. Just make sure not to tent on the preserved area (follow the signs at the entry point). Too many dont follow the restrictions, which is a shame... great view and perfect for swimming (but quite cold water)

name: Next to river
description: a dead end road next to river. A gravel spot a couple of hundred metres from the road. bit of an angle but at least a couple of nice spots. overlooking the river. no noise from the road. a steep bank, not kid friendly.

name: Riverside
description: multiple spots by the river. very quiet. good for everything from big rigs to tents.

name: quiet place by lake
description:
Moderator Note: This Place is rejected as the User apparently did not stay overnight.

car park/turnaround. surrounded by forest. didn't stay the night but looks nice

name: Morgedal
description: Guest house by the E134 way. Cheap, nice and very friendly owner.

name: Most Northern point of Europe
description:
A beautiful place. The most northern you can go;worth a Hike!
small monument and a hiking book to sign in. Good weather: great views to northcap. Took us ~6hours (total&breaks).

name: Grassy spot between current and road
description: Only spot in The Valley to camp for free... it’s right next to a road used by the electricity company (not a lot of traffic). It’s in small forrest and it fits easily two tents or even a rig. Fireplace is also there.

name: Hodnaberg
description: Nice little place where you can park and set your tent up, by a small river. Space enough for a couple of cars and campers. Its right next to the road, but not much traffic here. Quiet place on the mountain.

name: Near Lake
description: Park your car on the big parking lot. Walk hundred meters toward the lake and you will find a big open spot with a campfire. There is also WC in parking lot.

name: Parking by the river
description:
A bigger sand parking spot beside the road. There is a small bridge that goes over the river to a small plot of forest.

The parking lot is quite flat.

name: Hiking to Steindalsbreen glacier
description: Start -parking lot- for the hike to Steindalsbreen glacier. A good marked nice hike up to the glacier&into the lovely valley. 6,2 km which took us~5,5 hours (total incl. breaks).

name: Beautiful River Spot
description: This place is next to the river, at the end of a little Road. Sunrise in the morning, No Sunset place.

name: Near road
description: Accessible only by bike / on foot. easy tent spots!

name: Lakeside
description: Big parking place near a Museums Farm. River and lake near by. Place for All cars/trucks and fire. Near the sightseeing road 13. But less traffic in the nights. Standing for one or more nights. No paying

name: Next to the river
description: Driving up the small road turn 4 km before the end of the road left on a small dirt road and you’ll arrive at some sort of rudimentary camp spot. You can park your vehicle there and walk another 50m on a single trail until you’ll arrive at a grassy spot with fire pit next to the river. The place fits at least two small tents. Beware of the mosquitos!

name: Place next to the river
description: Small place next to the river and with a view of the forest. Fire place included. Next to the street. It is quiet as well

name: Syltøy Bobilparkering
description: New campsite for camper vans. Very nice spot. Fishing possibilities and walk trip.

name: Storvik cheap gas Station
description: We filled up with fuel for 3,5 NOK cheaper than other stations ;). As well a small store&nice beach.

name: Kvalvik Fort
description: Nice and calm Place. No Services. For 5 Campers.

name: gravel pit Korgfjellet
description: Very quiet small gravel pit in the woods with some mountain view. we were not visible from the road,windshade. very little traffic on the road above the tunnel.

name: Truck stop
description: Truck stop beside E6 with proper toilets and place to dump your RV waste tank. Small tents might be able to be put up on the hill, next to the river

name: Defender camp
description:
A small grassy area next to a field&surrounded by forest. For 1 car. Away from the road, but you can hear it.
A steep rough forest track goes up there, 4x4 recommended & you need good ground clearance!

name: Roadside stop w/ toilets etc
description: Just off the E6; tables, toilets, lots of space for putting up a tent and plenty of parking. Nice evening sun, near river but obstructed view.

name: Kjenndalsbreen Glacier parking area
description: At the end of the private road to the glacier is a large parking area. Multiple spots for campers, picnic tables on site. Maybe you can find a spot for a tent but it's a rocky area.

name: Mosc hiking Dovrefjell
description: Parking place to start different hikes into the fjell with good chance to see moscs. We did a small tour up to Hogsnyta (total 8 km~ 3hours). Take your binoculars.

name: Roadside parking
description: Public free parking connected to a walking route with scenic view of the Atlantic. Garbage disposal, concrete table and possibility to park rv for the night (we did) and camping on grass. Small wall towards the road so traffic noise isn't a problem.

name: Lillehammer Lake side
description: Small harbor & beach place (nice for a swim), next to a forest with view of the lake. You have to go underneath the train tracks (3,2m), maybe not for very big rigs. you reach directly the beach & you can go the gravel path a bit further. train doesn‘t really bother.

name: Lake Follsjå
description: Camp site with a small hut and fire pit. Right next to the lake. Only accessible by 4x4, bike or walk. There is a small park spot for 2-3 cars next to the road ahead. Several spots for tents. There are several bushes with blueberries around.

name: Skaget View
description:
Nice grassy rough stone pit at the treeline with amazing view onto the fjälls and Skaget mountain. Depending on where you camp, wind, shade & not visible from the road. Very quiet & abandoned except for the sheeps. A river is nearby.
A good gravel road leads up into the national park (toll 70 NOK).

name: Ringoy Camping
description: Formal campsite next to Fjord. Level grass pitches for campers or tents. Electric hook up. Can be a little exposed in bad weather but beautiful setting. Clean toilets and hot showers. Small kitchen available. Not manned all day. Owners come around at night to take payment. Free firewood. Free WIFI.

name: Hokksund Camping
description:
Big campground. A lot of all year camper  but separated tent and campspots for one or more nights. Great and very clean facilities, which are included in the camping fee. 
Swimming and fishing grounds, playcourts for kids. In the end of August not loud at all.
For one night with tent a little expensive: 280 NOK, with electricity 320 NOK
Free wifi.

name: Steinstøberget Rasteplass
description: Scenic view point with toilets, large picnic area, fire pit and access to swimming area.

name: Kjerag Lysebotn Camping
description: Very nice and quiet campground. Clean and new facilities. Great view into the fjord. Tents have a very nice spot. Campervans have to park in the second row. Kitchen and facilities are free to use. 260 NOK (26 € p.N.)

name: hjerkin
description: nice spot away from full parkingspots along the route. gravel, so it’s accessible, but 4wd advised. some road noise

name: Riverside
description: Sweet spot down by a river on a peninsula. Do not park on the beach when you arrive, it’s low tide and the river will rise enormously! It’s a slightly muddy dirt road and not manageable for big rigs over 3m height. Vans and truck campers won’t have a problem.

name: Nedstrand woods
description: A small and nice place in the woods. Enough room for a car and a tent or a campervan. Too small for big vehicles.

name: Near Street
description:
There's a parking spot next to the street. I pitched up my tent behind some trees, not connected to a private spot nearby. It's on the highest point along the road.  

Moderator Note: The User clarified that the camping place is not on private land. 07 Sep 2020.

name: Parking lot next to the lake
description:
nothing too exciting next to a lake. nice view but not too quiet since close to the street.
20min to the ferry though

name: Camping spot with a small hut
description: Nothing special, place for several big rigs. Some tables and one hut with a table. I camped there and was happy to have the hut because it rained heavily on the morning and I could pack things in the hut.

name: Old football field
description: In this area there are several places where you can stay for the night. This one is a old football field with only one goal.

name: Hidden roadside rest
description:
Just a stretch of sandy abandoned road, running through the little forest parallel to Storvassveien road (#82) along the Storvatnet lake shore. 

Follow it further and you'll get to a small bridge, blocked by stones, road is in disuse since a long time, and cars can't proceed further. 

We parked for night at one of many places where it is wide enough to let other car still pass just in case. You can still hear the passing traffic on the highway (not a busy one), but trees in between effectively block the view, so no one sees you from the main street. The abandoned stretch is fairly long, allowing a lot of space and there are some good approaches to the lake from here. 

Good alternative to staying directly next to the road in full view, good entry point to the lake, otherwise nothing special and no facilities whatsoever.

name: Sætran Camping
description:
Small campground. Very cheap. 100 Kn for me and a tent. Small kitchen. I was alone here, so it was enough. Washing machine available.
Internet is fast, but I don't know, if it's available all over the place.

name: football field
description: You can camp at the edge of the football field. After I pitched up my tent the police came. But they just said that it's ok to camp here.

name: Gasemyr Camping
description: Very basic but cheap campground. 150Kn for tent or campervan. Small kitchen, small laundry room. No wifi. Other prices in pictures. Only cash, no cards. But you can also pay in Euro. The owner has change. I don't know if electricity is available at every spot.

name: Fjord shore
description: Big quiet asphalted parking with couple of tables, waste bins & pit toilets. Easy access to fjord shore.

name: Bore Strand camping
description:
Nice place to camp if you want to go surfing. You can rent surf boards at surfschool. Check their website, Twitter or Instagram. For two days it was 320 Kr for boards and wetsuits included.
Camping with tent is 150, camper 350, shower for free, kitchen was closed due to Corona, washing machine and dryer available.
WiFi only at the reception, but very fast.

name: Cut-Off into River
description: There is suddenly a cut-off in the road by a river crossing, one cannot see it. It looks like the road goes on as there is drop in the trail. There is no warning sign. Accident with 2 bikers already happened there.

name: Ballesvika
description: A nice quiet beach with some picnic tables. Accessed down the end of a side road. Visited when cycle touring.

name: Behind gas station
description: Trucks, on a large parking lot.

name: Sortvik Rastplats
description: A lovely car park at the side of the road looking out to the sea. Places to park cars and picnic tables. Toilet there also.

name: Songesand Camp
description: Songesand Camp offers rooms for 2, 4 or 5 people, a place to put up your tent and a place to park your camper.

name: Ytra Dørvika
description: Ytra Dørvika is a beach along the famous Lysefjorden.

name: Skjersviga caravan camping
description: Camping spot near Pulpit Rock. For big rigs drive in from Jørpeland, the road from the Pulpit Rock is narrow.

name: Byrkjedalstunet
description:
Byrkjedalstunet is a well known Hotel/Restaurant/Shop for locals and tourists. 

This is a good stop for everyone going to or from the famous Suleskarvegen and Lysebotn.

name: Kjeragbolten
description: Kjeragbolten is located over Lysebotn and is most famous for the stone wedged between the mountain.

name: Ølberg camping
description:
Ølberg is a summer camp open from may to august.
It is located with a nice beach and a WWII bunker. 
Ølberg offers a kiosk and a restaurant. 

A popular place for the locals to visit during the summer.

name: Buøy Camping
description:
Buøy Camping is located in Dalen near Dalen Hotel, Eidsborg stavkyrkje and is the last stop of Telemarkskanalen.
You must be 23 years old to camp here.

name: Seaside
description: Place right next to the sea. Room for 2-4 cars or 1-2 caravans.

name: Lammetun Camping
description:
Camp site lies close to the sea, with a fantastic view to the fjord. Space for caravan and tents.
At the site there are toilets and showers, washingmachine and tumble dryer.

name: Reed Camping og Fritid
description:
Established beautiful campsite for caravans, tents and cute cabins. Motorcyclists are very welcome and get a little discount. 150kr for tent with MC
Mexican restaurant 10min walk.

name: Wild camp at sea side
description: Small place close to the sea. Room for a couple of cars.

name: Blefjell Camping
description: Charming small campsite with a fantastic view of the mountains. Price for a tent 190kr.

name: River camp
description: Great place next to the river. Quiet. Large camp area.

name: Forest camp
description: Nice place in the forest. Can easily fit 4-5 overland rigs.

name: Beach
description: Camp at the beach. Nice place next to the lake

name: Romsdalseggen camping
description: Nice small camping place. Quiet and away from the road

name: Forest camp.
description: Small place for 2-4 rigs in the forest. Short walk from camp down to the fishing lake. Lots of nice roads and spots in the forest

name: Aurdal, Valdres
description: A great campsite with lovely cabins by the lake

name: River camp
description: It's a very nice place with good views of a beautiful river, and away from the road so no one can see you.

name: Wild camp next to small lake
description: Quiet nice place close to a fishing lake. Room for 2-4 rigs on the road.

name: Sand beach
description: Fantastic place next to the lake on a sand beach.

name: Borgund hyttesenter og Camping i Lærdal
description: Sweet small spot surrounded by the mountains but next to the road. We didn’t hear traffic in the night time. Possibilities of cabins, caravans and tents. In the morning a beautiful view of the mountain. Small cabin 450kr.

name: Skogrand camping
description: Small spot for tents, caravans and some cabins. We got a 2 bedroom with shower  cabin for 750kr. Quite nice price. Flat tent ground with a beautiful view on the fjord.

name: Lakeside
description: Super quiet and beautiful location. I had no problems to camp.

name: Misvær Campingplass
description: Nice camping spot for caravans and bikers.

name: Silfar Canyon
description: Nice parking spot for caravans and tents. 50m from the road. Outdoor toilet and possibility for camp fire

name: Logging road
description: This is a nice place for an overnight stay while passing through. Fun gravel road to get here, and a nice view from the top. No access to water, but possible to make a fire. Only accessible for motorcycles if the gate is locked.

name: Tunhovd
description: Side of the road. Nice place in the evening

name: Tunhovd
description: View over Tunhovd fjord. It is  on a side road. it is on a small incline. Ground is not leveled out well, it's a little rough.

name: Tunhovd 2
description: Level ground. 50m to lake. Stream  close by.

name: FURU hostel
description: Very nice hostel with dorms (37€) and rooms. Food and drinks available. Clean and nicely organized spaces. Plenty of parking space. Lovely chill out areas.

name: Storsand Gård Camping
description: Awesome tent camping spot directly by the sea. Clean toilets, flat ground

name: Wild camp next to lake
description: Small place for 1-2 cars. Next to the lake. Quiet and cosy

name: Orkanger
description: Camping by the river, campfire site and flat space for tents and cars.

name: WW2 war ruins and wild camp
description: War ruins from ww2. Also room for some cars to wild camp.

name: Parking next to Norsk Skogmuseum
description:
Dump station for black water, fresh water also available. You get the key for 100 kr at the museums counter. 
Museum is okay ;-).

name: Langen
description: Nice place with benches and garbage binds. Allso there are a toilet here and parking space. There are a bug flat grass field to set up tent on the southern part of the site.

name: Jærstranda
description: Nice daytime parking at the beach. Toilets.

name: Røros overnight parking lot
description: Not a campground but official overnight parking lot. Very close to the old city of Røros. Normally 250 kr/night, 300 kr including electricity (support of the local sport club).

name: Trondheim motorhome parking
description: Parking lot and overnight stay for motorhomes. Around 80 places close to each other, but only 32 sockets with electricity - friendly sharing with your neighbours  Around 20 minutes walk into the city center, 30 minutes to the cathedral. Fresh water and toilet disposal available. 300 kr/24 hrs. We arrived Saturday evening around 6 pm and got almost the last free slot… so be here in time.

name: Vinjeøra
description: Vinjeøra next to sports field and local school. Very nice place with a fantastic view over the Vinjefjorden, no amenities.

name: Vinjefjordskroa
description: Toilet and disposal for toilets as well.

name: Blue Water and View on the Mountains
description: Great place to stay for a night. Almost no cars. Good to fish and to stay if you want to go climbing the next day

name: Furuhauglie Camping
description: Great place to stay. Campground is located in a in a area where you can observe moos with a bit luck

name: Motorhome Parking
description: Official parking area for motorhomes, dumping of waste water, toilet, showers and wifi (we didn’t use) available. Around 15 minutes by foot to the city center.  325 kr/24 hrs. Come early - we arrived half past six and got almost the last free place.

name: Landfallkjern
description: Big parking lot by the lake. Beautiful spot. A lot of walking and hicking opportunities, fishing in the lake, swimming and toilets. You can stay overnight but the toll road closes at 11.00 pm and opens at 06.00 am. 40 kr pr day in parking fee.

name: Innfjorden fjordparking
description: Perfect spot for wild camping, absolutely quiet, amazing landscape. Enough space for 3-4 campers. No amenities.

name: Gravel spot next to the road
description: Not really a scenic spot. Actually only reason to spend the night is because it's on the transeuropean trail. There is a small stream. Probably drinkable as most water in Norway

name: small beach at Orkla river
description:
A small sand beach next to the Orkla river
A little bit of Road noise from the higway 3 but quiet at night

name: Vinje Campground
description: It was a little difficult to find an overnight stay with our motorhome arriving in Geiranger around 7 pm. Really touristic but really worth a visit! All campgrounds seemed to be full but we could stay on the unleved grass at Vinje Camping. 340 kr/night with wifi and electricity, in our opinion a fair price for that super touristic spot an Norwegian level ;-). The road is quiet during night, surrounding waterfalls quite loud but create a very relaxing atmosphere. We slept very well!

name: Jacq
description:
Beautiful wildspot. Near fjord, sandy beach nearby, very quit.
About 4 km gravel road .

name: Hov Hyttegrend
description: Very nice campground at the river, big distances between the parking slots. Very clean toilets and showers (10 kr coin for hot shower). Good start for hiking along the Fossestien. We paid 180 Kr for the campervan plus 20 Kr per person plus 20 Kr for electricity. Free WiFi at the reception.

name: By the water
description:
Great spot at a former Harbor. It's behind a white wooden church.
We saw Minke Whales at the fjord.
Up to 4-5 campers can park there. It is a 15 km drive from E6

name: Mountain camp
description: Nice quiet place next to a small fishing lake.

name: XY Fuelstation and dumping
description: Fuel station with dumping option in the selfcare wash box. Fresh water available. For 20 kr.

name: Wild camp next to lake
description: Quiet and really nice place next to the lake.

name: Solvorn Camping
description: Official campground belonging to a farm, simple but nice. Very clean shower and toilet. As we recognized the only option to stay overnight with a campervan in Solvorn. 300 kr/night. Around 10-15 minutes per feet to the ferry that will bring you to Urnes (high recommendation to visit the UNESCO church).

name: Parking Lot
description: Parkingplace at the E6. A railway track is close by. Fine for a night to stay.

name: Wild camping with a fee
description: Wild camp but the owner of the place takes 120kr pr night. Very nice next to the lake

name: Langneset
description: Wild campsite deep into the woods of inland  Norway - along the shores og Lake Halsjøen. Run by the National Forest services (Statsskog) Popular amongst the locals but for everybody to use. Have a few benches/tables and a couple of dry toilets. Room for lots of rigs and tents. Fishing possible, berries in the right season as well. Quite good Telenor signal.

name: Jacq
description:
Great Place, about 8 km wat from E6.
Near the river/ fjord.
Several places along dirt road.

name: Between the Bunkers
description:
Nice flat place between the bunkers of Tjeldøy

Cool place to explore the bunkers
Couple of dry toilet's on site and a nice Grill hut with fire place

Last 4/5km of the road requires high ground clearance (bumpy road with rocks and holes)

Multiple places to set up camp

name: On an island near the Waterside
description: Beautiful place near the water in a dead end road on a tiny island.

name: Sanitary area for camper
description: Water tap at a sanitary area for Camper near E6

name: Dirt track nearby Fjordborg
description: Dirt track from the main road 862 leading to a lake and waterfall. Whem wet can be tricky to park up ( return can be difficult) .  Please respect the immaculate prestine spot to spend the night, so it will not be blocked in the future by locals. There is a notice at the end the local vommunity depends on the water source for their drinking water.

name: Wild camp close to the river
description: Gravel road with a turn around. 50m from The river. If you have a offroad rig you can drive the last 50m down to the river and camp in the river bed

name: Holum Camping
description:
It is a really nice Vamp, quit and direct at the river. You can use all, electric, water, toilette, etc.
200,00NOK all in for a Camper

name: Nice view near Nordkapp
description:
Great place next to the E69 with nice views
Small/rough (4x4) trail leads to a plateau with multiple fire place's

High ground clearance recommended
Little bit of road noise but not as bad as on the North cape parking lot

name: Tent spot on a lake side
description:
Beatiful tent spot on a lake side. 
It is a one minute walk down the way from the road. On the other side of the road is a parking spot for at least two cars.
Someone left plastic chairs and a table at the lake side. It is very easy to go into the water and we met a local man that came to swim there. The sun sets over the lake.

name: Lake Side Tent spot
description: Little tent spot on the lake side. A lot of sheep around carrying bells. The water of the lake is clear and cold. A few huts are around.

name: Beach
description:
Secluded beach spot. Locals have put some chairs and a little hut against the weather. In front of it is a gravel spot and a toilet.
Internet 4G+.

name: Jacq
description: Down the road to Nykvåg 50 m down to a former Harbor. No noise from the road, perfectly quiet.

name: Folgefonna northern glacier ski resort parking
description: Parking of the ski resort in sight onto the northern Folgefonna glacier. Spectacular view onto the glacier and the surrounding mountains.

name: Vestsidaveg
description: White gravel beach close to the river. Narrow gravel road to access

name: Eggum harbour
description: There is a small pitch out of the gravel on the dike. I slept one night there and in conversation with a fisherman he confirmed it didn’t disturb. A few steps away you have a small but beautiful sandy beach strip in between bolders

name: Lille Gunnarsjøen
description: Wild camping in the norwegian wilderness near Femundsmarka Nationalpark. At the shores of Lake Lille Gunnarsjøen, a bench and table and a dry toilet. Room for campervans and tents. Beautiful surrondings, down a 5 kms gravel road though, so careful when its wet. Lots of reindeers wandering around, ospreys on the lake. Fishing possible (fees apply) canoing also at the lake Glen an extra km down the road. Weak phone signal in the area possible.

name: Moodden
description: Nice park like camping spot by the river (Nidelva). Parking lot, fire places and small buildings (gapahuk). Regularly used by families.

name: Stavn Camping
description: Two sites on either side of the road - can camp by the river. Can buy shower tokens. Clean toilet and shower block. Nice people. Find a spot and they come around for the payment in the evening. Caravan, tent or can also rent small cabins.

name: Lervika
description: Camping right at the bay with a stunning view on the sea and mountains. 4x4 only.

name: Skjellivatnet Fisherman’s Camping
description: A big grassy spot close to a little lake. No toilets, services or anything really. 40NOK per day. Perfect for a night before/after the ferry.

name: Nearby Flakstad
description:
A nice pitch for 2-3  4x4 ‘s or compact sport campers on a gentle higher level. The first section is gravel, followed by rocks and the last part can be very muddy after rain. The spot is relatively close to the street but the surroundings are beautiful. There is a small pond by the waterfall. 
Please leave the spot tidy, or it will be blocked by rocks from the community, as we notice more and more.

name: By the river in Lesja (Lora)
description: Beautiful and secluded place by the river. Relatively flat ground with room for 2-3 rigs. There’s a fire pit and a bench. Possible to take a bath in the river. Full 4G coverage.

name: Parking spot in the wilderness
description: Beautiful spot with few fireplaces and firewood available as well. River is pretty close, lake few minutes by walk. The way leads over a gravel road

name: Camper toilets
description: It’s NOT a dump station for water!! But a nice spot with a view, toilets for free and a place where they automatically clean toilets of motorhomes and campervans. It even inserts new chemicals:)

name: Black and Grey Water
description: Dump toilet and grey water, refill fresh water. free.

name: Lake Granasjoen
description:
Small space next to the road suitable for a night stop. there is no service.
.....
piccolo spazio accanto alla strada adatto ad una sosta notturna non c'è nessun servizio

name: Hafjell Bikepark
description: Free showers at the Hafjell Bikepark. Open from 7-21.

name: Hemre
description: Small camping with 4 cabins (NOK 45), shared bath/shower,

name: Dumping, grey an fresh water for free
description: dumping, grey and fresh water for free. b

name: Folldal scouts ground
description: Campsite with several shelters that seems to be used by scouting activities. Has several picknic tables, a fire pit and good 4G reception. entrance through a parking spot next to a school.

name: Tolga shelter
description: Small open shelter with picknic tables, benches and small areas with grass. Good 4G reception. Close to the river. Parking about 10m from the spot. Two places for fire or bbq.

name: Tydal riverside shelter
description: Small shelter for cooking and a fireplace next to the water. Not accessible with ordenary cars or vans. Accessable for 4x4 with extra ground clearance, bikes and motorbikes with off-road tires. Be careful because road is muddy. The shelter has a message from the owner that you can camp but he wants you to pay NOK100,- by Vipps.  Take your garbage. Fishing is not allowed.4G reception is fine.

name: Campspot resting place Tronesdalen
description: Parking / resting place with toilets, next to a river. Campervans would fit easily on the parkinglot, but there is a much nicer place for tents a few meters further with more picknick tables, fireplace and accessible for bikes and motorcycles. 4G reception is average. Excellent swimming spot.

name: Korgenfjellet with a view
description: Nice gravel place. Flat. A nice view of the lake. Plenty of space for several overlanders.

name: Singsåsfjellet - by the lake
description: Nice spot by the lake. Toll road from the village. Only online payments. Mountain road with relatively ok conditions for most cars.

name: 4x4 forrest camp
description:
Very nice spot!

Bumpy road up the forrest, 4x4 with high ground clearance needed. 

The drive up is the fun part! Very secluded.

name: Lesja lake spot
description:
After a bumpy dirt track you will reach this spot aside of the lake and at some relatively good flat surface. Surrounded by trees and close to the lake. 
There are some cottages nearby so respect distance to not making the locals block the spot.

name: Slettafossen spot
description: On a smaller way down from the main road, heading Sletta, there is a flat gravel spot nearby the waterfalls.  Good for an overnight stay

name: Freshwater refill
description:
A Freshwater source and a dumpstation for Greywater next to a little Harbour.
But you have to bring your hose with the Gardena adapter.

name: Koa Camping
description:
Big space camping with sea view, renewed cabins, clean shower/toilets 

750 NOK for cabin

name: Rotsundelv Camping
description:
Very nice, old fashioned camping (est.1970!) inside the forest!
Very quiet, plenty of space for caravans, tents, also 10 cabins available.
Very clean and the sweetest old woman, owner in Norway!

name: Lie Badeplass
description: A nice Spot next to the Fjord, officially for bathing, but you can sleep here as well. Toilet and running Water. Many other campers here, too.

name: At the lake with small beach
description: Wild camping spot for one car at the lake with small beach. Recommended 4x4, not too big car (not for truck). Nice swimming. Quiet. Beach is  slopy, but if you do not want to level your car then park 15m before beach where is flat.

name: Beautiful lake at paid road (75 NOK)
description:
amazing spot for RV, campers, and tents at beautiful lake, situated at paid road (75 NOK). Lots of space, for more than 10 campers.
Weak GSM signal ! = Weak Internet !

name: beach at the lake
description: flat beach at the lake, situated at toll road (75 NOK)

name: flat beach at the lake
description: lots of spots at the lake, flat beach, nice view

name: Wild camping spot with nice view
description: wild camping spot for 2 cars with very nice view for lake, it is not far from road, but there is not too much traffic on it. Very weak or none GSM signal.

name: Small camping spot at the lake
description: Small camping spot at the lake, very close to the road but there is very little traffic here. There are two places  for one car each. Both 15m from road & 5m from lake. Not amazing but it's OK if it is late and you need to stop for night.

name: Camping spot at the lake with nice beach
description: Beautiful camping spot with nice beach, suitable for swimming, nice view and few tables.

name: Camping at the lake
description: Small camping at the lake, nice beach, table with chairs. Recommended price is 150 NOK.

name: Parking at the lake
description: small parking at the lake, not the best spot (gravel parking) but if you are tired and it is late you can stop here, there is place for few cars...

name: Hidden camping spot
description: Hidden camping spot 100m from the main road, at the lake. Place for 1, max.2 cars, possible to open tent as there is a lot of grass around.

name: Sandy & sunny beach
description: Sandy & sunny beach. Nice for swimming and kayaking. Place for 4 campervans.

name: Shady spot at the lake
description: shady spot for 2 campervans or 1 big at the lake, close to the road but there is not much traffic.

name: Beach behind the church
description: Nice shady place in small forest at the beach behind the church. Place for 2-3 campers.

name: Mittet camping
description: Camping at the Sea nothing special but everything  is here.

name: Close to Lysebotn
description: Right before a narrow bridge there is a short dirt track leading to the riverside. The track becomes sandy and upto the end nearby the boulders is a nice strip to spend a tranquilo night to be well rested in a nice surrounding for the next day of action

name: Waterstream nearby Brokke
description: A pull out from the road on some gravel aside of a river. The river can be very fast flowing and there are warning signs. Spectacular at certain moments. Pitch itself is relatively flat.

name: Sandbekk mølle
description: Toll road to access the area. Several good places to park. Good gravel roads.

name: Close to Lakes
description:
Wild camping place with benches, place for tent, close to lakes.
It is quite cold here as it is about 1000m above sea level,
Place for a few campers around (few km each way). There are a lot of similar places with benches too, some of them have pit toilets.

name: Langsua National Park
description: Official free camping place at paid road (60 NOK small car, 95 NOK camper), at the lake, with benches and pit toilet. Very close to Ortjernkampen / Langsua National Park.

name: Dump station + water
description: Dump station + water. If you want to park for day or night price is 50 NOK.

name: Riverside
description: Spot for 1 or 2 cars at the river, between trees. Steep access to the river. Close to the road but not very noisy.

name: At the lake
description: nice place at the lake woth stone beach, close to the road but there is not too much traffic. there are 3 spots here = for 3 campervans, one for each :)

name: Langvatnet, Torbudalen
description: This is a part of the lovely Aursjøvegen

name: Wild forest park
description: Nice big parking space for wild camping by the river! with picnic tables

name: Campsite and coffee shop
description:
Campsite/motel/cabins/coffee shop. 

Not sure about the pricing. just stopped to refill my water bottles. but probably better deals than the place nearby.

name: Public shelter
description: Public shelter space for a couple of tents. Roofed but open on three sides. Tables and benches beside it

name: Small Peninsula near Alta
description: Had just lunch here, but it is apparently used for camping. Many firepits. Might be high frequented in summer. No facilitys. You do not need 4x4 or a good clearance.

name: Next to Rd. 813
description: Its next to the Road 813, but very quiet at night. We had a beautiful clear sky with nothern lights. Good for one night. At one side is a big parking lot, at the other side is a gravel road a bit up, where we stayed. But its not very hidden. Just a good place for milkyway and northern lights whatching.

name: Verrastranda
description:
Very pretty sleepingplace. Picknick spot, at the waterside of the Verrasundet Fjord. With  fireplaces and benches. Even toilettes,  but locked. 
Beautifull views.

name: Oldjerford Camping
description:
Easy place to stay for the Nordkapp.
260 NOK (€26,-) 2 pers, car rooftent. 
Showers 10 Kr, 6 min.
Washmachine and dryer free for use.
New clean sanitair, still building.
Many Norwegian yearholders with hut and caravan. Some of them stay here when the road is closed in winter.

name: Wild camping next to The sea
description: Wild camp under the bridge next to the sea.

name: Øysjøen
description: Campsite close to a small lake, room for up to 8 cars. firepit and simple toilet. Please take your rubbish with you, don’t burn or bury it!

name: Lysø
description: Wonderful location nestled in the dunes with direct access to the Atlantic Ocean. View on Atlantic Hwy. Partly very private tent or camper spots. Easy going operator and moderately priced (Aug 2021: NOK 200.- for tent / 2 persons / 2 mororbikes) Very clean facilities.

name: Leknes
description: Big Restarea, with toilettes and possibility to descharge the toilette cassette. Nice area with picnic tables and nice view in the mountains

name: Behind the church of Varoy near the sea
description: Place near the sea behind a church flat and place with a table and benches for 2 or 3 camping-cars. It’s an access to put boat on water, so it’s better to let place for cars if necessary. We have no body seen.

name: Giljanes
description: Camping and hostel. Camp on tarmac and use shared amenities with hostelguests. One of the few campsites which is open during winter.

name: Nice place to pitch a tent
description: Easy to access place to pitch a tent. Close to water and close to the road.

name: Beautiful place by the lake
description:
Beautiful place for one or two tents. There are several other places along the same lake where it is possible to camp.
There are some farm animals in the area (cows and sheep).

name: Steinvik Castle Parking
description: Gravel/grass parking area at the fjord used by fishing enthusiasts, visitors of the 16th century fort and campers.  There is a pit toilet and trash cans.  There are some benches and fire pits closer to the fort.  Overnight camping is allowed against a small fee of 150 NOK payable by putting cash in an envelope and depositing it in a mailbox.  There is enough room for about 8 campers.

name: Riverside in mountains
description:
A lovely riverside wild camping spot. Just off a small road. Camping on the riverbed
Four wheel drive only 
Beautiful views
Very cold in winter!!! October -12

name: Forest spot by a lake
description: nice quiet place near a lake in the middle of nature

name: Beautiful beach spot
description:
A beautiful beach camping spot
Toilets were closed in October 
Could be busy in summer 
Flat ground

name: Wild camp close to the sea
description: Small and cosy camp place next to the sea. Enough space for 2-4 cars. The road down is hard to see and it’s to small for big cars

name: Krokbekkvika
description: Small gravel slot alongside the Trysil river. Toll road NOK 50.  Mosquito rich area, several good fly fishing areas

name: Villcamping in Våler Finnskog
description: This place is an old settlement from the stone age. It can fit cars with rooftents and small trailers. There are benches, fireplaces and shelters on the camp site, as well as toilets and water pump with drinking water. Handicap friendly with wheelchair ramp into the lake.  The lake is a popular for canoeing

name: Large vehicles parking
description: Place for big rigs (could be for many trucks). Next to a petrol station and fast food.

name: Wild Camping next to the lake
description: Small wild camp next to the lake. Will fit maximum 2-3 overland rigs. Small stone beach next to the place. Narrow road to drive down. Not possible for large vehicles.

name: Water at gasstation
description: Water tap at gasstation. There is also the possibility for disposal of grey water.

name: OSA Mountain
description: Nice camping spot for small caravans and motorcycles. Not for big rigs because of the corners and small road. Windy and cold but beautiful

name: Roligheden Camping
description: Roligheden Camping, which is run by Dyreparken, has a fantastic location right next to one of Kristiansand municipality's finest bathing spots, with a large lawn, sandy beach and boulders! The tranquility is 2 km from Kristiansand city center. Here you get everything you could want from a campsite, including with modern sanitary facilities.

name: Camping at the coast of Vega
description: Beautiful place at the end of the road, with beautiful seaview. There is a picnic table, a shelter and a dry toilet. It is at the start of a 10 km walk along the coast. There are other options as well to park and camp along this road, just before this spot.

name: gronsvik kystfort
description: Coastal fortress, made by the Germans in WWII. The museum is only open in summer, but the bunkers and the beautiful surrounding area are open for public all year round, free of charge. Really nice to check out if you are doing the coastal route, it's right next to the road.

name: Nice spot at a lake
description: After crossing a little bridge (no big campers) there is a small area with grass and a beach. Wonderfull views, a fitepit and lot of trees. Road is a bit noisy.

name: Turningpoint at dirtroad
description: At the end of a dirtroad in the forest is a turningpoint, a circle. You can see the lake from here and it is very, very quiet. Beautifull place and excelent for the night.

name: Roadside
description: A fairly large car park with good gravel access, it can easily fit several motorhomes.  We were alone here with a tent for one night.  Good phone range. Place for a bonfire.

name: No name
description: place for 2,3 tentes, close to the road. Just 2 km close to the ferry. Nose when the ferry operate, but calm at night.

name: Nordland National Park visitor centre
description: This is a visitor centre of the Nordland national parks and an art galary. There are nice exhibitions here about nature and art. It is free of charge. Worth a visit!

name: Campspot and shelter near storvikvatnet
description: Nice place to camp at Storvikvatnet. There is a turning/parking circle where you can park, but also a place next to a beautiful maintained shelter (please keep it clean and tidy!). There is a hiking route starting from here. Note that you should take the road from the northside of the tunnel (so the road on the left side right after the tunnel, if coming from Storvik), even though Google maps says you can also take the road from the other side. This road is heavily damaged and is impassable on one point due to a landslide.

name: no name
description:
In the wild. ~500m from the main road. Tractor tracks,  with the bicycle ok. Cars no.
At the end place for 2,3 tents.

name: Fjærland
description: A flat open car park area next to the Fjord

name: Brimnes old ferry dock
description: Unused ferry dock with ample parking and public toilets

name: The Camp
description: Place for a few tents between a tunnel and the fjord. Parking south of the camp.

name: Cozy pull-in stop 1 km from Burfjord
description:
Head south up the hill 1km from Burfjord.
Perfect for small camper vans, cars motorbikes, cyclists.
A quick pull in to the right is a lovely flat cozy spot. Traffic doesn't bother with river noise. Very quiet night.

name: Lakeside
description: It is a flat stony area beside a little lake. Nobody here. Lots of space. If you like, you can swim and wash in the lake.

name: Very nice camp area near Sørbotn
description:
This is a beautiful idyllic camp area with fire pit ,picnic bench , stunning views, access to the river for fresh water.
Full 4G signal 900m up from Sørbotn off the main road.River noise just about cancels out the road traffic noise, so quiet.
Ideal for small camper vans, cars , motorcycles and bicycles.
Several places for tents.

name: Tvitjørnhytta
description:
A-frame with view on the lake. Nice place to stop on the Veloroute 12.
USB strom

name: Kvam
description: Large and flat parking area. Perfect location for campervans (Marco Polo).

name: Sel
description: Stop and sleep here. Gravel parking area for campers and caravans. Toilet right next to it.

name: Veen
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Place has not been visited by an overlander

Welcome to Veen Gard - a natural gem for the whole family!
You will find us located in a beautiful cultural landscape surrounded by high mountains and vast infield pastures, with Gloppedalsura (northern Europe's largest stone clock) as the nearest neighbor. Short way to nature experiences such as Månafossen, Preikestolen and Kjerag.

name: Villa Avanta
description: Tent spots with a view of the fjord next to the road. Parking spots with room for vans. Good signal. To get to the tent spots, cross the road from the parking space. Google maps categorizes this as a hotel and names it "Villa Avanta", but it's just a couple of boat sheds that are blocked off due to risk of collapse. No houses nearby.

name: Bruheim Camping
description:
nice small campground next to the river. easy shower and toilet. warm shower for 5nok. friendly stuff. 
250nok for car + tent without electric!

name: Gullarfjellet
description:
Camping next to the Walterfall.
not to reccomend If its rainy

name: Road on high plateau
description:
New big flat gravel parking area. Allowed to stay overnight. The location next door is still not accessible in June die to snow.   Maybe this is the reason the built a new one. And more along the vert beautiful road to Vik and Vangsnes. 
No facilities. But the view is superb.

name: Holmo Hardangervidda
description: parkinglot at a waterfall with Option for a Tent. there is no gras

name: hardangervidda parking lot
description:
parking Lot next to the river. Beginn of trail for Hiking. 
tent is possible in the forest.

name: Voss Camping
description:
Beautifully situated among the trees, beside the lake in Voss. It’s only a short 5 min walk to the town center and all the activities and facilities on offer there.

We are open all year round. Main season 1 May – 1 October

Reception opening times: 09:00 – 21:00, 7 days a week from  mid May – mid September

name: Mountains
description: Small area next to the road. Room for 2-4 cars. Nice mountain view

name: Kaggefoss spot
description:
On Kaggefossveien, when coming from Fv280, right after crossing the dam, there is a little area on the right, right next to the water.
There's a good view over the water and little traffic.
The river has high flow here and there is a sign warning that the dam gates may be opened without warning, further increasing the flow. Going in or near the water is best avoided.

name: Riverside
description: Wonderful spot close to the river and not far from the road. Great for overland sized vehicles, motorcycles, or bicycles with a flat spot for a large tent or parking. Excellent for a night of sleep while traveling.

name: Laukvik bobilcamp
description:
pitch (Bobilcamp) with electricity
and WC, shower, washing machine and dryer.

name: Rindal
description: Free drinking water at Gas station YX and waste disposal

name: Fjordutsikten Motell & Camping
description: A wonderful and friendly place for cyclists. Cyclists are very welcome and have the opportunity to wash clothes for free. Highly recommended.

name: Revsholmen view
description: Small parking for up to 3 cars or 2 RV, small path to a view where you can set up 3 tents

name: Bjerka Camping
description: Camp Site with place for Campers, Caravans, Tents. Cheap cabins for rent if you need shelter from rain (like me today) - payed 305Nok for cabin with 4 beds, fridge, electricity.

name: Fjordutsikten Motell og Camping
description: Nice view, incredible hospitality, very good price. You can rent tent place or cabin.

name: Parking historical site on fjord
description:
The best place since our trip on Norway. 
Top view on Sunndalsfjorden and the mountains around. Easy access to the water. Next to a historical side. And it is on a dead end no cars passing. 
4g access.

name: Ellingsgarsen grill restaurant and Camping
description: A grill restaurant besides the road and camping and cabins. Also long-term trailers are here. Food is excellent in the restaurant. High level of service.

name: Another nice spot just past the gap
description:
Heading away from the spot by the bridge, 200m going away from Sammaroya turn right up a dirt track and there's a nice spot also.Less windy and better sheltered I felt.
Pit fire there too.

name: E6 Vestre Porsangerveien
description:
You are not visible from the road. You can walk from the toad with the bicycle.
Only accessible by foot.

name: Langnesveien
description: Parking place with 2 shelters. At the water's edge.

name: Madland Havn Shipwreck
description:
A nice place for multiple campers and tents in a nearby field. Beautiful view over the sea, including sunset, and the nearby shipwreck 
Quiet place even if you can hear the road in the distance. There is drinking water on the quay. There are also toilets (hang on for the smell!). Not much room for tents. Check the weather forecast in case of strong winds.

name: Helganes Bru
description:
Nice paved spot to camp with car or campers. Not suitable for tents as it is rough pavement.
Multiple places at the parking spot on top of the bridge, and one place below the bridge deck.

name: Nordsinni
description:
Parkingplace in Forest near a creek.
Heatet WC. Peaceful and no Traffic at Night

name: Halvorstol Bru(bridge)
description: wide area for two campers or other vehicles. Alongside a road, bit not many traffic. A little river flows nearby.

name: Dagali Rest Place
description:
A Parking lot with place for multiple campers, tents, cars ect. Provided with good sanitary, toilets, washing place, SHOWERS are OUT of SERVICE. A donation box is also in place for renovation purpose in the future to keep this place alive!
Also fresh drinking water is available on the left of the cabin.

name: Asnes Finnskog
description: Small area near the lake. Very nice to nice to swim. PitKlo nearby (near the church). To stay for 1 night . Nearby there is a coffee Restaurant.

name: Skardvatnet
description: Very small camper or rooftop tent spot. The view is beautiful over the lake. The spot itself is not suitable for any ground tent due to rocks. Also the traffic is a little noisy when there is any, but this is not frequent.

name: Water at Joker supermarket
description: At the parking of the Joker supermarket you can get water for free.There is a water hose and a sign that says you're welcome to take fresh water. Very kind!

name: Eisdal
description: Vert quiet camping, 260 nok for camper ans 2 people

name: Bridge view
description: Beautiful place at the beach with view on the bridge and mountains.

name: Small Camping Spot near Lake
description: Great quiet Campingspot with two tabels and a beautiful view and there is enough space for a car or camper. You can also jump into the Lake!

name: Wild Campingspot
description: It is a big pasture with small lakes everywhere, there are many beautiful places where you can stay with a camper or tent!

name: Epic beach in a bay
description:
An epic small beach located at the end of the road. Beautiful sandy beach, protected by the wind. Sun mostly from morning till afternoon (depending on the season).
No shower, no toilet, no waste bin.
Small parking lot, but sign explicitly forbidding camping.

name: Parking lot next to cemetery and beach
description:
A parking lot suitable for up to 10 cars, if parked in rows. Big rigs also fit.
Next to the parking lot are picnic tables and a dry toilet, which was closed during my stay.
You can also put tents on the area of the picnic table.
Idyllic beach in a bay with sun nearly all day. Can be crowded with other campers.

name: Sandnes Camping
description: Very nice little campground next toe the road. Owners are friendly. All facilities available. €39 with power.

name: nice little café in harbour
description:
A nice little café in the harbour of the village. Very nice people, comfy and relaxing atmosphere.
During nice weather you can sit in front and enjoy the view across the harbour into the mountains. During cold weather you can sit inside am warm up yourself.
They are offering different varieties of coffee and tea. You can get plain waffles or with sweet or with algae and balsamic. They are also offering ice cream and cake.

name: Roadside
description:
This spot consists of a parking area where at least 4 or 5 vehicles could park. There were 2 RVs on the parking area and we put up our tent on the huge meadow next to the spot, which is a little bit hidden from view from the parking area and the road, which is nice. There is not a lot of traffic, so it's very quiet. There is a wooden picnic bench and table and the view of the mountains is incredible!
We really recommend this spot if you're close to Bodø!

name: small spot beside a quiet road
description: a small place for 1 or 2 small tents, vehicle can be parked right in front of the tent. the road is very quiet, almost no cars pass.

name: River parking
description: Small paved lot for maybe ten cars.  Used by fisherman and dog walkers.  There's a river to sit by and a grassy overhang for longer vehicles. No signage prohibiting overnight.  4G reception, rubbish bins but nothing else.  Not much around so be self sufficient.   About 30 minutes to city.  Not much choice in the city and parking is costly.  Good for the night before going in.  There was some traffic noise till about ten then quieted down.

name: Spiterstulen Parking
description: Parking spot at Spiterstulen. We didn’t rent a cottage but asked at the reception if we could park the van for the night. Paid 220 NOK.

name: Repvåg
description:
Plateau overlooking the fjord.
Need 4x4 car or off-road capable mc to get up here. Room for few tents. Wildcamping. No fire pits or anything. Leave the place clean!

name: Sleep with View to a Waterfall
description: rocky place with a view overlooking a waterfall right on a road with little traffic

name: Cahppesguoika KO
description: A nice shelter with fireplace next to the road and river.

name: Small spot next to the lake
description: A small spot next to the lake. Ok for vans and doable for tents.

name: Next to road spot
description: A small spot for a van or for a tent right next to the road, pretty close to the Hessdalen information panels. 40 min hike to the mountain top for a nice sunset view.

name: Roadside
description: A small gravel pit. Place for big rigs and everything smaller. Not scenic at all, but works for a night. Almost no noise from the road

name: Roadside
description: Nice view of the Mountain Sata, quiet place in natural surroundings.

name: Breiddalsvatnet View
description: Beautiful place with a lake view and a creek which passes next to it.

name: Rest place
description: It is a rest place next to the road, separated by a tree line. There is also a table with benches. It's a nice and pretty quite place for one night.

name: Free RV parking near Kongsberg
description: Great spot next to a river with a swimming hole.  Large gravel/dirt lot - maybe 15+ campers.  Bathrooms and dump facilities (both black and grey) and rubbish bins.  4G signal.  No potable water.

name: wild camp + beach near river
description:
small campsite next to the river
there is a small beach, fire place and table

not suitable for big rigs, place for 2-3 vans

name: Nice Camp close to Dovrefjell-NP
description: Small flat place with fire ring. Fits one camper. With a good clearance and maybe 4x4 you can go down a little dirt track and you'll find a grassy flat area with another fire ring. A bit up the road you'll find a parking place (Trail to Grimsdalhytta starts there), there is more place.

name: Parking place near church
description: It's a parking spot after you pass the church. It is at the base of a forest. The place is very quiet since the road is a dead end and it's rarely passed.

name: Parking near the bridge with a nice view
description: Small gravel parking next to the bridge. Nice views, can sit at the water. No facilities, no trash cans. You will hear the highway traffic on the bridge.

name: Parking near lake
description: It is a parking place near the lake. It's pretty quiet, the road has small traffic. Very good for one night.

name: Large parking place
description: Large parking place at the base of the forest, with tables, garbage dispenser and toilets. It's next to the road and can get a little noisy during the day.

name: Haugsjå
description: Nice camp spot, close to the lake. Space for mutliple vehicles.

name: Olderdalen
description: Almost next to the ferry are cabins for 100NOK a person. If you are the only one there, you have a private room, of course, but if there are more persons, you share one. Bring your own sleeping bag. There's a small kitchen with enough utensils. 1 hot shower and toilet. There's an open WiFi network from the supermarket next door. Expect nothing fancy, but for the price it's an absolute bargain.

name: Lighthouse
description: 2-3 quit hidden spots near the sea. Only suited for 4x4 or small non 4x4 vans when not to muddy.

name: Forest off road track
description: Beautiful track deep in the forest with some places to stop and camp. Not much open area though. Requires a capable 4x4 and some careful driving. Watch out for the boggy ditches. (We were not so careful).

name: Orkla River by Fannrem
description: Gorgeous spot West Bank of the Orkla River. Easily accessible with any vehicle. We got our motorcycles down here. Large enough for a van or small camper. Small travel trailer possible too. Next to the Orkla River where we even saw some huge salmon jump out of the water. Excellent for fishing.

name: Rauland lake site
description: Beautiful place. The beach is drivable, recommend 4x4, but locals seen without. Sand and stones on a long shallow. Not sure if it is allowed to drive without a reason one the road out here.

name: Torghatten Camping
description:
A Camp ground close to the ocean. NOK 350-500.
It is the only place for start a kayak trip close to the famous hole/cave in the rock.

name: Small spot by a stream
description: It’s a very small spot for one tent, next to a small stream and bridge. The dirt road is roped off but you can park just before that. It’s a really nice spot for backpackers, cyclists or people with a small tent and car. If you have a big vehicle don’t drive down the road since it’s a dead end, turning with a regular car is easy. Not suitable for rv’s etc. It’s really quiet during the day and at night.

name: Bergen
description: Two empty buildings for backpackers etc to sleep in, a big table and a fire pit. But it is very basic! It is not reachable by car. You will have to walk from the road up a hill about 700/800 meters. The spot is very nice, I was alone at the end of June. It’s also on google maps.

name: Beautiful spot by the lake
description: Take the gravel road down from the rest stop (there’s a picnic table here) and you have an amazing spot surrounded by the lake with some trees around you. Great for swimming! There’s no facilities.

name: Evanskjer
description: Sanitair dump station near harbor. Some camper places to park for the night payable by paypal

name: Place Next to a lake
description: quiet place on a road with little traffic above a lake.

name: Quiet Place with a table
description: a quiet place with a wooden table with benches, not far from it is a lake

name: Lake View
description: a place directly on a little-used road, behind it a path leads to a small hill from which you can experience a beautiful sunset.  across the street is a lake where you can swim.

name: Beautiful spot with view of Briksdalsbre
description: Small gras field next to the road (quiet road at night) with an amazing view of the lake, the mountains and Briksdalsbre. You can go down a few rocks and reach the water. There are no other facilities, but a couple hundred meters further there’s a parking lot with a toilet and trash cans.

name: Storviksanden Camping
description:
Very nice and pretty new campground.  No office so you can book online.  The website allows you to choose your spot.  
All amenities included in price even use washers and dryers!  Fast WiFi, paved pitches with artificial grass patios.  Playground and very classy to a nice long beach. Well maintained and clean.  4G cell reception too.  We paid 400 NOK which seems high but not when it includes being able to wash and dry three loads!

name: Honeymoon beach
description: Found this beach on our honeymoon trip. Visited again 20 years later. Stil as beautiful as we remember. Please keep it that way.

name: Camp site next to cycling path
description: cool spot outlooking the ocen. Situated next to the bicycle path. After the tunnel you can park on the left side of the road. Walk up the hill.

name: Langsanden Beach
description:
Huge parking next to Langsanden Beach. there's a little stream with fresh water for drinking.
there is also a service house with toilets and showers. It costs 10 nok for a shower for a few minutes.
Great location for campers and tents.

name: Gaddevaggi
description: Nice place with fish farm in front of the place. Just a nice parking with some fire pits.

name: Vikran
description: Nice place. Good place if you like fishing. No facilities. But nice and level.

name: Moen
description: Parking by the sea. Very nice views. Good parking for about 15 camper vans.

name: Alta Harbour
description: Large gravel lot next to harbour office.  40 NOK for 1 day.  Pay at machine or thru EasyPark app (be aware there is a service fee when you use the app to pay). Toilets in harbour office. 4G cell reception and you can access the free wifi from the office or an Alta free one.

name: Campsite by the river
description:
Several spots for both tent and roof top tent etc. The road is bumpy so SUV or larger car is recommended. 
Grocery stores and gas stations nearby.

name: Abandoned road next to waterfall
description: Perfect spot for roof tent etc at this old road which is not in use since the tunnel was build. The road has a dead end so there's no traffic passing.

name: Andopen midges
description: Beutiful spot for atleast two tents overlooking the bay and small fishing cottages. Midges will company you on a non windy day xD. Can park your car on the end of the road.

name: Abandoned quarry near the road
description: There is an abandoned quarry in the mountains close to the road. We camped here for the night, really quiet and remote place.

name: Bjørnli
description: Nice parking. Sports fields nice and level. Good for motorhome or caravan. Not ideal for tents.

name: Freebie campsite
description:
Campsite next to a river with a small beach, toilets, fireplace, two Volleyball courts and a diving platform (approx. 5 m height).
The river is fit for swimming and fishing (salmon).
The site is free of charge and was empty when we arrived.
The only downside is a nearby factory that is working 24/7 and gives a low hum at night.

name: Wild camping spot, next to a lake.
description:
Much space with three campfire places.
Leaving several cabins to the left follow the small path. Additionally, use the entry to the east and don't damage the plants around here.
Take your waste with you and leave the place at least as clean as it is.
Nevertheless, enjoy you time here.
Mobile internet available with a download rate up to 100mbit/s to plan your next trip.

name: Place on the lake with a firepit
description: Place on the lake. You can build a fire. A lot of muskitos.

name: Møssvann campsite
description:
A silent place right with a big freshwater lake. 
It is possible to drive all the way down to the lake if you have a car that can go a little bit off-road. 
After talking with locals. They didn’t mind that people camps her ass long ass they clean up after them selves. 
A beautiful place with sun from early in the morning on to sunset at the summer.

name: Fortun
description: Nice parking close to the road. Good and level good place to stay, no facilities. Vehicles over 10 meter are not allowed on the road op here. Very nice views brilliant place to stay the night.

name: Multiple nice spots near hiking trail
description: There are multiple nice flat camping spots along this dead end road to a hiking trail. If you drive further up the road you will see them. There is a toilet at the and of the hiking trail or at the rest stop very close by (<500m). At the rest stop nearby are also a places to stay, you have to follow the trail to the back for a big open space, very nice.

name: Gorv og Camping
description: Nice campground by the lake on the way to Jotunheimen NP, camping and glamping tents rom 250, huts from 450. The owner puts a lot of effort into the campground, pretty clean and nice place

name: resting place Nordland
description: small site just off the road. picnic tables and good grass for tents. although the sign says only resting place. toilet and natural water

name: Nice spot near a lake with stunning view
description: Waterside area with a stunning view on a mountain forest. Ideal for wildcamp especially after a trip to the giant kettle.

name: Really Nice place bbq pit bbq tabel on the beach
description: It is a Nice place on the beach with a bbq tables on the beach and also one with a roof. There is a toilet and you can sein

name: Sivilforsvaret - Big Old Parking
description: Big Parking, calm, room for everyone, isolated but not that far from the ferries

name: Small beach
description:
Place for 2 (max 3) cars and a trail to a small cozy beach (1 min walk). 
Before the beach, there is a nice flat place to put 1-2 tents on the grass.

name: Spot with beautiful lake view
description: To get there, you will need to zoom in on the GPS to find the road. (At least on Google Maps) But when you get there, it will be totally worth it! Just the view is just stunning, and there's multible places to set up camp.

name: Seaside
description:
Nice spacious place next to the water, 
you can also walk your dog here.

name: Wild camping near rocky river
description:
Camp site near Road and next to a Rocky river.
Secluded camp site by trees close to the road. Space for 1 or 2 tents and a car. Direct access to the river. Also, campfire infrastructure ready to use.

name: Water tap in a park
description: Public water tap in a small park right next to the Coop shop for thirsty visitors of the Midsun steps.

name: Stor-Elvdal
description: Nice little fishing spot a few meters higher than the river. Space for 4-6 cars. The road in can be a bit rough at times (4x4 is recommended)

name: Rauneskogen
description:
Found this place while searching for a campsite.  Obviously, camp sites are as rare as elks in this area. What we found is a place to be private next to the road (200m) but not be annoyed by the road.  The mobile network is fast. 
Perhaps it could be closed by a gate.
Sorry for bad quality pictures but it was  dark and  I was tired.

name: Beachside
description: Nice place next to the beach. There is small glass shop and glassblower and also a toilet.

name: Dagali
description: Parking along the road. Little traffic but it is close by. Good place to start a walk from. No facilities but you’re on your own.

name: Riverside
description: Follow a small road down to the river. Here you will find a nice secluded camp spot. Space for multiple tents, Cars or vans.

name: Bergesjøen Outdoor Area
description:
Nice spot with possibility to tent on the grass or park your motorhome at the parking area. Benches to sit and eat and public toilets (but no running water). Many locals go there to take a bath, but not so many people in the evening (and we visited in July).

The "no parking" signs are a bit confusing but only apply on a tight road down to the lower parking area closest to the water.

name: Skjervsfossen
description:
Parking lot, WC, water
Possible to pinch few tents on ground
Waterfall, nice view

name: Lake side camp area
description: A big gravel paved flat area down from the main road next to the lake. Stunning view over the fjords. Can place up to 10 vehicles on the water side. Boat ramp also available.

name: Water Spigot
description: A spigot in the water pipe that goes to Henningsvaer that seems to always be open.

name: Silkesjøen
description: Very Nice spot at a lakeshore. Nice beach. Room for 3-4 friends. Accessible by ordinary car with a bit of clearance. Approx 20m from the road but no traffic at all here. Fishing possible. 4G good signal.

name: Nomestrand
description:
Beautiful beach in between Lunde and Ulefoss.
Great location for sunset.
Overnight camping allowed for 3 nights.
Public toilets available.
Great spot for tents and swimmers

name: Nice place in the forrest
description: Nice place to park for the night. Space for 3 or 4 cars

name: See the dolpins wim in the fjord
description: Place next on the road. But a Really Nice vieuw and dolphins are swimming in front.

name: Fylkesvei 825 Road
description: Picnic table, fire pit, on the beach in the fjord

name: large place
description: Take the dirt road to the right when coming from the North. Just below is a very large and flat place, quite hidden from the road. The night we slept hier were three camper vans, and our tent. and still plenty of space.

name: Front the sea and mountains
description:
Middle place for campers and tents after a long gravel road.

very quiet, beautiful view.

name: Notodden Camping
description:
Paid camping by the river "Heddøla" that flows through the valley. Showers, kitchen, wc, washing machine and snacks, also a Chinese restaurant on the other side of the neighbouring air-strip.
Pitch a tent, park your trailer or rent a cabin.

name: At the border of the forest, end of the path
description: The place is at the end of the path near the lake, just behind a gravel pit. It works there in the morning, but not so much noise, and we were hidden. We arrived at 9pm and saw two mooses on the path !!!

name: At the river bank of Lakshol
description: beautiful camping spot very close to the river with cover provided by the trees. the place has a beautiful view off the valley. There are some fire pits here. It can be some what muddy if it rains

name: Circle K
description: Shower for 30NOK. Hot water. Ask at the desk.

name: Jutulhogget
description: Wild camping with dry toilets, quiet despite being close to road. Only con is that whole parking area is sloped - problem with leveling your vehicle.

name: Near a lake
description: Nice place to camp next to a lake. Parking on asfalt for campers and there are also spots for tents. There are nice clean toilets available, picknick benches, fire pits and you can also swim here. This place is popular with the locals, even after 22:00 but they don’t seem to mind the overnighters being here.

name: Riverside
description: Nice spot close to the river. Room for 2-3 cars.

name: Amazing river camp
description: Really nice river camp. Room for 2-4 cars and flat spot for normal tents.

name: perfect spot
description: When you arrive with the ferry at Rysjedalsvika kai, go to the left for 200 m. There you will find a small house, it seems like a bus stop. Behind that, there is the perfect spot to pitch your tent.

name: Water Spigot
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User asked shop-employee for permission

Free water in the wall of the souvenir shop at the town square

name: Good spot next to the road
description: Enough space for a tent or car. Now water or toilet. Nice View!

name: Place at sea coast
description: Nice spot for a tent or two. Only available for motorcycle or by foot

name: Picnic table and nice view near river
description:
nice place at the top of the fjord. There is a picnic table and a lot of place to camp. Not recommended for RVs but ok for 2x4 or 4x4 cars or vans.
There is a toll for the road of 40 NOK.
There is also a waterfall if you wanna take an iced shower 😋

name: Medfjørdvær
description: Online camperplace on the fjord. So you can the way upstares en there is a beatiful Parking where you can see the sea and the mountians. Also hinking

name: Riverside rest (motor)bikes
description: Nice spot between wild river and road. Has multiple picnic tables and plenty of room for many (motor)bikes and tents. Not accessible for rigs, but cars and vans can be parked 50m away on a parking area. Water is natural, but you might need to cook or filter. Open fire only allowed part of the year. No toilets, but bins for garbage.

name: Slådalgsvegen campsite
description: Good place for almost any kind of camper. Plenty of place for rigs, bikes and tents. Has a small half open shelter with picnic table and an outdoor picnic table, some fire pits and an outhouse. Very windy and open and next to the gravel road. Quiet though.

name: Gullesfjordbotn
description: Very nice campround with everything  you need

name: Skulestadmoen
description: Next to the petrol station. Dump grey water, refill drinking water.

name: Bærsal Rest Stop
description: Rest stop with nine tables, close to river

name: Primær Fylkesveg
description:
Large gravel site next to the road by the river overlooking a waterfall. The road is not busy despite the weekend in May/June. Used by several campers.
------
Großer Schotterplatz neben der Straße am Fluss mit Blick auf einen Wasserfall. Die Straße ist trotz Wochenende Mai/Juni nicht stark befahren. Von mehreren Campern genutzt wurde.

name: Lakeside
description:
The ground is flat, it's suitable for fishing, according to the sigh that says you need a fishing pass.
There is direct access to the water. A gravel road goes next to it, but it's not busy. You need to pay a toll for using the road, it's mainly used by locals that live around.
There is a fire spot.

name: rest area
description: A rest area where you can sleep, is next to the road. There is a toilet, a park, tables and also a kitchen.

name: Fjørsjøen
description: Nice place by a small lake. Room for 2 cars. A steep decent coming down from the road. 4wd recommended.

name: Merratjenn
description: Small camp near a lake. 2-3 cars. Easy access.

name: Maristeinøyne
description:
Place near a small lake with fish. RV friendly. Room for 5-7 cars/rv’s. 
Good 4g reception.

name: Place direct at the Riverside
description:
Great spot direct at the E6 main road.
Enough place for 3 campers. Fireplace available.

name: Riverside
description: A beautiful flat road of pebbles leading onto a river. Next to a road, but hardly any traffic. Sun all day on a good day.

name: Nice Spot down the Fjord
description: Nice Spot on the 86 down at the Fjord with a great view

name: Tungestølen glaciers
description: Beautiful camping and parking space. With a view of the glaciers. It is also the start of a really cool 6-hour hike to the Austerdalsbreen (glacier). The way towards here is a two-way single lane (don’t drive too fast when no view ahead) and even single-lane tunnels. The last bit requires a small road toll (70kr) it is surrounded by meltwater so even quite cold in the midst of summer. Enough stones to make a campfire, and there is a toilet. There might be other hikers but it’s so big you can pitch your tent quite far from others. You have 0 cellphone service here.

name: Hikers parking
description:
At the end of a gravel road, there is a spot that a lot of people use to park their cars and start a hike. Next to a twin waterfall. 
There is a field to pitch a tent (as we did), but you first need to find a dry spot. 
There is more than enough place to park a campervan.

name: Nice spot on the beach
description: Nice spot on the beach with 2 Shelters and tables. Enough space for tents.

name: Air BnB Annelise
description: Found this place in Air BnB. The host is Annelise. She & her hb are super nice ppl & very helpful. Double room cost EUR50 (in AirBnB) during summer, inclusive self make breakfast. Its the cheapest u can find in Harstad. Comfortable room in a nice house. Its not a hotel actually but a home & only 2 rooms available. House is #14. Walking distance to the center. Fast wifi & complete kitchen. Very clean & heated toilet even in summer. Truly recommended for a comfortable stay & rest. You can call to make a booking directly +47 954 06 121

name: Down a small pebble road, by the waterside
description: The road is about 20m higher, but little traffic. You have access to the water and the ground is flat. A little fire place is available.

name: coffee, grocery and fuel
description: a small grocery store, with fuel and a nice ans cosy self-service Little café

name: Campsite on the roadside
description: A grassy area next to a parking, at the corner of Hagskarveien and Finstadveien. Rather hidden from the road, but you'll hear it anyway. There is no watter directly at the spot but there is a river flowing 300m down Hagskarveien, on the road to the camping.

name: Farmcamperplace for start Ryten trail
description: Nice place to stay for start the Ryten trail. 100 No kr. for 1 nicht. So you can also online park for the trail.

name: Paradisbukta
description: Nice spot at the bay. There is space for multiple tents. There is a toilet and some picknick benches as the place is used for recreation by some locals. There is a small car park where you can park your car (not directly near the tent spots).

name: Kvina
description: Nice beach parking at a quit lake.  Big enough for a couple of cars. Tents possible on sand. 2 Picknick tables. LTE.

name: Nice spot on the beach
description: Nice spot on the beach Behind a parking with toilets and tables. Few spaces for tents right on the beach. 1 table on the beach with fire place.

name: Shiv Sleeping under the Stars
description: In order to access this spot you need to pass a barrier which you will find closed unless you are driving a bicycle or a motorcycle, in which case you can go around the gate. It belongs to a farmer who checked on us as we had made a fire and kindly reminded us to keep it small. We stayed there two nights and he didn't mind at all. Very quiet, access to the lakes, space to pitch your tents, so wild and beautiful. From there you can drive around the trail to reach Dagali.

name: Mebostad bathing area
description: A nice place close to Bjugn with a nice view. The gravel  road is a bit steep. The locals bathe here by day, and some kids might party at night. When we were here, someone had a nightly dip. Has a small marina. Free shower and toilet. Lots of space. Costs 106 Nok, and you can stay 24 hours. Paid through the website with creditcard, accessible by qr code at the campsite, and pasted below (sadly, only in Norwegian).

name: Near the water
description: Little hidden away campspot, only accessible on foot or by bicycle. Place for a few tents and a campfire. Beautiful view over the Bødofjord.

name: Norex Camp
description: This is a small spot on my farm. I welcome all overlanders to stay here for free. If you need any travel tips or advice you can search me up on instagram Norex Overland. Remember to Pack out all your garbage.

name: Skadbergvågen
description: Hut, fresh water passing by, fjord, quiet arm to swim. Very quiet. Along the #1 cycling route. Takes 300meters walking from the gravel cycling route. Easily accessible by boats.

name: Reipå camping
description:
Nice little camping for camping cars, tents. There are also cabins available.
