The owners are nice, showers are clean and hot, the small kitchen is well stuffed, and the price is rather cheap for Norway : 150NOK for one person in a tent on 22/08/2022.
8kms away from Ørnes ferjekai

name: Parking Lot at Skalandtunellen
description: Parking Lot at Skalandtunellen on the 862 with a nice view on a Lake

name: Established wild camp
description: Large open camp area. Open for everyone. Not sure if you have to pay to stay here

name: grassy spots in the mountains
description: many big and small spots along a gravel road, enough space for several cars/tents, right next to a lake

name: Next to the river
description:
Place between road and river, but you can find a place away from the road.
Very clean, camp fire possible and very nice view and access to the river

name: Sjoa Vandrehjem
description:
Sjoa Hostel is beautifully located in a quiet area between the rivers Sjoa and Gudbrandsdalslågen.
The hostel is originally a farm from the 13th century, and they offer good standard facilities. Family cabins, double-, 3-, or 4-bedded rooms. All our rooms and cabins have ensuite bathrooms.

name: Ståvatn
description: Several tenting and camper locations along gravel road off Harddanger National tourist road. incredibly beautiful surroundings, main road is relatively busy but quiets down in the afternoon.

name: Brynntjønna Lake Access Road
description:
A small dirt road that goes all the way to the lake, and along the way there are plenty of level spots. The GPS coordinates are for the turn onto the road itself. Way more secluded and quieter than the rest area that's just a little further down the road.

Also, some maps show turn-off to a road that leads to the Litltjønna lake. However for that you'd need to take a bridge that collapsed some while ago and looks like it is slowly claimed back by nature. :)

Small rock quarry in the middle, but there was no machinery, no signs and no one at the time.

Note: In the iPhone app, this road is not marked on the Apple Maps whatsoever, but you can scout the coordinates on satellite maps.

name: Mjelva Camping and Cabins
description:
Mjelva Camping and Cabins is  located 3 km from Åndalsnes with beautiful views to the most famous mountains in Romsdalen. 
They started in 1964 and is a family-run campsite in scenic surroundings. We have 19 cabins, 9 of which are high standard

name: Berg Marina shower
description:
5min hot shower for 20 NOK, also access to a bathroom and toilets.
You have to call the number written on the door to get the code.

name: Shower at the ferry stop
description: Free hot shower in the bathroom next to the ferry stop

name: Sildvika camping
description: Official camping, 15 NOK per tent on 26/08/2022. The campsite is nice, showers are clean and hot. There is no kitchen, but there is a shelter to eat. There are also cabins.There is a box to leave the money, with the number of the owner (the house next to the camping). It seems they also offer rooms there.

name: Tjonnefoss kraftverk
description: Nice place informal campground for about 3 campervans. And a couple of tents. No facilities but nice walks in the area.

name: Small spot next to lake
description: Few boats and a parking spot for a few cars.

name: Gravel road to boat ramp with small parking spot
description: Great view with what looks to be a flooded mine or just a lake. Gravel road from some interesting houses leads to a boat ramp with small parking. No camping allowed unfortunately.

name: vik beach
description:
Nice place to camp on the beach with space for 10 campers
Private grounds without any services 200NOK

name: Porsgrunn
description: Informal camping/parking place near the beach just 3 minut walk. Place for a couple of campers. If travelling by tent there is a lot of space at the beach there is a gres area. And there are also toilet facilities.

name: showers and laundromat
description:
showers available for 100nok /pers 
really clean place 
there is some toilets and a landromat .
i don't know the price for the lundry .

name: Hoøya beach
description:
Hoøeya Island is a designated area for recreation and outdoor activities featuring barbecue areas, a volleyball court and toilet facilities.
There is parking and plenty of camping spots.
There is a restaurant but it was closed the evening I camped here (Sunday).

name: Sønstevatn Lake
description: Really nice elevated parking spot next to main road overlooking the lake area

name: Old logging road
description: Gorgeous view. Follow the small logging road all the way to the end. Vehicle with little more than average ground clearance suggested.

name: Sykkelbua bike repair
description:
Bike repair workshop, fast, efficient and accurate in price (even cheap for Norway !).
They fixed my bike 2h after I brought it (I tried nearly all other bikeshops in Trondheim and they were too busy to take care of my bike).
They also fix road bikes, which is not the case for all bike shops in town !

name: A quiet parking lot in busy and crowded Horten.
description: After looking quite a while, we’ve found this quiet parking near Tivoli strand and the city of Horten.    In the weekends some local kids can come here to party but how have you been in your twenties. We are visiting their city, so we should respect them.    Close to Horten-Moss ferry.

name: At the Dam, nice place to stay overnight
description: nice place to stay overday or night at the dam, nice view

name: Wild camping near a dam lake
description:
A nice spot near a dam lake, you should park at the entry of the path before the fence. There is not a lot of space but for a normal sizing tent it's fine. 
This spot is also used by fishermans.

name: Beautiful spot next to the river
description: Small sand beach next to a river. Beautiful view to both sides. You can enter it by a easy dirt road next to the main road.

name: Perfect beach
description:
Big wide sandy beach. 
Good for tent and 4VD
50 meter away at the road there is a parking spot.

name: Enjoy the silence
description: After a steep climb you will reach this place right next to a lake. The water is clear and you can easily take a swim here. It is in between two hills

name: Strandvegen 2-4 Parking
description: We stayed for one night, no issues whatsoever . Overall good

name: E8 Rest Area
description: Amazing view, large parking lot with picnic area

name: Talvik
description: Dump station and fresh water at the fuel station

name: Lighthouse parking
description: Nice spot for one night, wind repaired, spacious and safe

name: Seter camping
description: Cabin for kr400, has kitchen, pots pans, fridge, fireplace and 6 beds, great value for Norway

name: Skreda parking
description: Nice viewpoint, toilet and grey water available

name: Frostveien Beside water
description: place beside water. Nice spot for tent or camper.

name: Holand fjord tourist office
description:
Parking spot next to tourist office
Place 8-10 places, pic nic tables, free fresh water, toilets, and grey water dump
Bit away from the road

And the view is absolutely magnificent with one of the two glaciers directly across the water

name: Shelter at Fjørsjøen
description:
Shelter, where you can sit/sleep in and have fire. There is also a fireplace and a bench outside. Next to the lake. Beautiful, quiet area. There are several other places along the road, where you can camp. Some with benches and firepits.

For the road you should pay an "Avgift" (sms or kreditcard). It is a fair price to have such a nice, wellmantained place.

name: Source
description: An official water source (signs lead the way)

name: Wild camping
description: It’s a nice place between trees on a dirt road, close to a quiet road

name: Lofoten Camping Storfjord
description: Small campsite on a small lake. Nice cottages but also places for campervans and tents. We paid 300 NOK for our van for one night. Free canoes to go on the small lake, showers are 20NOK for 5min. Camping is beautiful!

name: Tromsø Lodging & Camping
description: Very busy formal site with cabins, RVs and tents. Shops within 2km.

name: Fjordbotn
description: nice looking spot with lots of RVs with good view.

name: Lots of open space
description:
Plenty flat space by river 
...,
......


...
..

name: End road in Forrest with view
description: A nice quite spot for camper (2wd), motorcycle and car. a small klim up and at the end you can enjoy the view. There is a spot to turn also for bigger vans such as 8 meters. longer not suitable. made a nice campfire and enjoyed the silence. there is a small stream where you can wash the dishes and clean up and a small waterfall.

name: Fjellhaugvatnet
description:
It’s a nice open space with a beautiful view to Fjellhaug lake and waterfall. 
There are few fireplaces, the camping area is flat. There are also rivers nearby. 
It’s a little traffic on the road.

name: Pier
description: It’s a flat, quiet  place nearby a pear. Living houses are far away.

name: Place in forest
description:
This is a very spacious flat place with no mosquitoes, about 300m from the main road (very quiet). 
There is a small river there, but it’s brown. It’s okay to drink, but in 6km north there is a river with clear water.

name: Place by the sea
description:
It’s a flat place near a small beach with barbecue. 50m from the main road. 
The nearest water source is in 1.2 km

name: Place at lake
description: Wifi available on the parking ground and around

name: Wild camp next to the lake
description: Nice and big area next to the lake. Room for 5-6 cars.

name: Hjertnesstranda
description: New marina service building with free outside showers,toilets,washing machine payable by credit card or Vipps.

name: Kragerø centrum
description: Nice parking at the water frond. Free from 18:00 to 08:00. Max 10 hours parking.

name: Wild camp on route to ferry
description: Wild camp situated 20 minutes from ferry at Kristiansand. Nothing special here, but good location to spend the night for an early departure next morning. To enter coming from Circle K, take a sharp right turn directly after the bus stop and drive down the road. Hidden from view of the main road.

name: Skien centrum camper van place
description: Nice place in the centrum of Skien. Place for 4 campervans. About 60kr including electricity. Short walk to the stores and you are standing near the water front.

name: Tana bru
description: New facility below and beside the bridge, 3 shield fire places. Just at the river

name: Layby
description: Nice place with branches, bins and toilets at the Riverside.

name: Lakeside
description:
large parking area.
a viewing area over the lake.
in daytime, in the Winter, people come here to walk the dog, hike, a walk over the frozen lake.
in summer it's busy !

im in the winter.

at night quit and alone.

in winter the pavillion is closed.

good for a stay of 2 nights.

name: truck stop
description:
24/7 truckstop 
water availble in toilets. shower 55 nok with credit card.
small automatic shop. gasoline.

i spent the night over here on the truck parking.
no problem

name: truckstop
description:
spent the night here becourse of the bad weather and snow.

there is plenty of room.

free water in the toilets.
shower 550 nok with credit card.

if there is no room at the truck parking.
in front of the building there is also a small parking place for smaller car's (van's)

name: Rest place with WC and potable water
description: This is an official rest place with WC facilities. There is also a potable water tap near one of the parking spots. The official parking area is marked off by an array of stones. You should not overnight in the official parking area, as it would be against the law. If you park or camp beyond the stones, it is considered “wild camping” and it is fine under Allemannsretten ("everyman's right"). Rather stony ground, so only recommended for vehicles or free standing tents.

name: parking near fjord
description:
great spot near the water and a gas station included a supermarket.
a restaurant also on the spot.

near the road but quit at night 

located at the entrance of a tunnel

name: sogn og Fjordane
description:
buitifull stop parking at road 5

clean toilets + water

name: Near FV152
description:
water for free.
toilets for free.

laundry 40 nok.
shower 20 nok.

clean and warm.

Pay at the supermarket.

name: parkin near libary/church
description:
big parking in front of the libary next to the church.

quit at night.

buitifulk vieuw at night at the church.

name: large parking
description:
large parking in front of supermarket and a hamburger shop.

the road whas closed in winter.
good enough to spent the night and hope that the road opens up next day.

on the other side of road tankstation.

name: water parking toilet
description:
warm water, toilet, 
rest stop on the road yo trondheim

name: parking near the ski jump ramp
description:
nice parking above trondheim
good for big rigs.
clean
48 hour stay alloud.

hiking trails nearby

name: large parking
description:
large parking 
supermarket
gas station
etc.

good for one night 
nothing special

name: small dirt road next to the water
description:
great spot just before the ferry on the road 17.

next to the water.

room for 2 a 3 4x4 and van's 

big rigs can be a problem.

great view

name: parking near Russion Memorial
description:
nice parking
some banks / tables / trash can.

near the memorial.

good for a overnight coming off the ferry

name: parking great view
description:
small parking near the 17
great views over fjord and the island mountains

name: Sinclair bobil park
description: Camping cars and camper van parking with water and electricity.

name: Vinstra vegpark
description: Short time parking for camper van and camping cars. Lots of service around.

name: Vinstra Hostel
description:
About the accommodation
Located in Vinstra, Vinstra Hostel offers free private parking on site and free WiFi throughout.

The rooms at Vinstra Hostel have shared bathrooms and toilets.

You can cook your own meals in the communal kitchen.

Car hire is available on site and skiing and hiking can be enjoyed nearby. Gålå is 10 km from Vinstra Hostel, Rondane is 25 km away and Kvitfjell is 26 km away.

name: parking near lake
description:
nothing special

good for overnight when leaving the ferry late

name: small parking near a small haven
description:
amazing spot to watch sun go down.

quit and at night lonely.



quit at night you are all alone

name: parking on the hill
description:
nice spot 4 km. from centrum of Bodo
view in front over water.
walk a 50 meters treu the forrest in the back and you find a amazing vieuw over Bodo.

daytime busy with hikers and day people.
at night quit.

there are outdoor fitness equiment availble.

name: bunnpris parking
description:
ask inside the store.
there is a large parking at the back of the store and when ask they let you park.

do not park in front of the store.
and do not drive to the haven itself.

that is a no go zone.

great vieuw to the mountains and haven.

name: Vollsdammen
description: Picturesque parking with forest and lake. Overnight free van parking.

name: parking viking museum
description:
large parking near the museum.

next to the road but at night quit.

good for a overnight.
handy to get early at the museum next morning.

name: parking near beach
description:
small parking next to the road in front of beach.

can be busy also in winter.

big rig friendly but then come early so there is room.

10 km from henningsvear but free of charche.

name: Flatraket
description:
Disused quarry at a quiet road.
Flat and easy access. 4G cell coverage.

name: parking by haven
description:
great spot, great vieuws
room enough for big rigs.
gravel surface.
small walk to center.
quit at night.

name: Leira
description: Big landfill, gravel surfaced, by the fjord. Room for at least 15 cars. Salt water fishing.

name: Large cozy camp by river
description: Beautiful and calm camp space by the river with a fireplace and benches. It is quite large and can easily fit up to 10-12 vehicles. Access by open gravel road and away from traffic and noise.

name: Large forest camp with fire pits
description: Large space for 4-6 vehicles in planned pockets, possibly more if you’re a large group. One finished tent space, and lots of close by space for tents in the woods around the camp. Access from a gravel road. Peace and quiet away from traffic

name: River side
description:
Narrow rocky path (only suited for high ground clearance trucks) leads to an open space in the forest. Fits 2-3 overlanding trucks. View straight on to river, some noise from the roads, not too bad if you have the expectation of some noise. 

You know the deal: Dig your human waste down or bag it up, don’t let toilet paper flow, bring ALL your trash with you!! Places like these get closed quickly if littering.

name: Roadside camp in beautiful valley
description: Roadside wildcamp by gravel road and river. Tall mountains on each side, road can be busy during daytime in high season because it ends up by Kjenndalenglacier. Access not possible in winter.

name: Gravel alternative to r15
description: Stretch between Lom and Vågå. Great alternative road instead of highly trafficked road 15. Mostly gravel. Scenic over turquoise river

name: huge open space next to fjord
description:
big open camp spot next to the beach.

and next to the road.

gravel and muddy when there is rain.

name: Hardangerbrua
description: Parking place by the bridge. Nice level place. Toilets close by. Nice path to the bridge great views there. Parking not very special. But a good place for a night.

name: parking next to church
description:
good for a over night on the way to northcape / Alta

shops at 500 meter.
gastation 500 meters.

flat concrete spot.
its out of the wind.
in winter they keep it snow free.

name: winter / out of the season
description:
when in winter you can overnight next to the centrum.

everything is closed nobody cares.

name: next to the to the water
description:
large place next to the water.
good vieuw

name: better than the northcape
description:
Amazing spot.Near de clif at a ww2 area (there are ruins of bunkers and canon's.

this is amazing.

vieuw over de barentzee.

a bench placed.
fire pit availble
there is a boat wrack near by.

the typical birds puffy's are here.

this is everything you want at the end of the world in the Artic.

litlle dirt road from town brings you here.

amazing

name: Øyfossen / Honnevja
description:
Fantastic scenery! 
Sit down and have a rest, cup of coffee and maybe a swim in a sweet water. There is toilets available as well.

name: parking near entrance to nature reserve
description: Just a flat space, 1.2 km from the watchtower.

name: parking near waterfall
description:
large parking.
surrounded by trees.
120 meters walk to waterfall

name: KABGuesthouse
description: KAB Guesthouse is 165 square-meter home, a 4-bedroom. A full bathroom, three bedrooms, a terrace facing the highest mountain in Bogen on the second floor and one bedroom on the basement, on the ground floor; living, dining, kitchen, veranda and toilet near the entryway. on the right side, a door going down to basement - bedroom, laundry and storage room for the house stuff. https://www.airbnb.com/h/kabguesthouse-4bedroomvacationhouse

name: Steinalderbuplass
description: Wonderful beach lake surrendered by mountain and waterfalls. Can drop dark water.

name: Frilsjøen Camping
description: Frilsjøen Camping - camping in front of a beautiful lake. RVs, Caravans and Tents allowed.

name: Midnattsol Camping
description:
Nice and quiet campground direct at the beach. 
Modern and clean facilities can be used after payment. (320 NOK; the doors can be unlocked via code). 
There is a nice and cozy room for resting wich gives a very beautiful view. Sauna is possible for extra payment and little huts can be booked for sleeping if the weather is not tent friendly ;) 
If the reception is closed (i.e. winter, payment is easy possible via terminal and the codes will be printed out). Hot showers cost 15 NOK / 5 min and are payed via credit card.

name: Quarry
description: A little spot to rest for a night. Space for 1-2 Vans. The street is close by but it did not bother us much. The dorrst is good for a walk.

name: Quarry Gas Station
description: Small unmanned Gas Station. Diesel and Regular available. No other services.

name: Wild camping near ferry
description: Beautiful grassy area behind the boat house, close to the ferry to Orse. Just for tents !

name: Wild Camping near Jektvik
description: Besides road 17 (Eurovelo 1) it’s a beautiful spot on the fjord for wild camping. there’s space for a several tents or a motorhome.

name: Kausbukta
description:
Gravel parking place with small beach, picknick places (bench, table, bbq grill). Trash can available. 
Free and allowed to stay overnight. You’ll not be alone here but it is very quiet and remote. 
300m in the woods there are more bbq places and a toilet. (Outhouse with dry toilet)

name: Svortåvatnet
description:
Small gravel parking place for the Svortåvatnet hike. Quiet and remote, not visible from the street. There is an entrance for a waterwork/powerplant in the mountain. 
Only for small vans or cars with rooftop tent.

name: Riverside
description:
Amazing spot to spend the night ! 
Be confident and come here. it’s a very nice place.

name: Sandan Beach
description: Nice camping spot along the beach with camping tables and fire places !

name: Torgeirs Plass
description: Amazing campsite near a gapahuk, with camping tables and fireplace. Great view over the seat. Uphill mud road to get access, but not long.

name: Veidnessletta Rest Area
description: Great rest place, with WC, camping tables and grass to pitch your tent !

name: Fjellstova Camping
description: Campground right next to the E39. Very new and clean facilities, shower is included in the price (No coins needed). Kitchen is a little old fashioned and not really comfy, but it is clean and does it’s job. Washer and Dryer available (50 NOK each) There is also a restaurant run by the owner. Good for a stop on your roadtrip ;)

name: Lonevatnet
description: Small place next to the lake and a little waterfall. Follow the gravel path in the young birches right after the crash barrier ends for 20-30m and you’ll find a perfect spot. Only for small vehicles like rooftop tent.

name: Hemsedal parking lot
description:
Basic parking lot, pretty quiet. Camped here a couple of times with my van without any problems. Not sure it would be good for big rvs. 
Please keep clean:)

name: Rørestrand
description: Nice informal campground easy access also with a bigger rigg. Toilets close now but are there don’t know when they open.

name: Oterøya
description: Nice place close to the bridge to Oterøya. Really nice and beautiful place. Good to have a nice walk. No facilities.

name: Mountain road camp
description: Roadside camp by calm gravel road. Short hike to a cabin and a view point over the fjord. Space for 5-6 trucks, no water or toilet,  it river nearby to fill flasks. Tollroad (sign was covered so could not see the exact fee). Local restaurant Good Mexican is highly recommended for food

name: Dalavegen
description: Gravel spot next to a quiet mountain road. Not visible from the passing street due to the trees and bushes. Good for a night on your way from/to Bergen. Locals are far away and no one you can bother. Caution: You have to pass a small tunnel with maximum hight of 3,6m.

name: stone bridge
description: Pull off road at bus stop, across grass covered stone bridge and turn right into wooded area next to stream.  Some road noise but otherwise quiet and undisturbed. suitable for motorbike access.

name: Eidsvika
description:
Beautiful spot with nice view, sun all day, fire place and picnic bench/tables. Used by the locals as well to end the day but they are very friendly. 
1 toilet, but signs that inform you to use the free restrooms in the small store up in the village, so please do „it“ there ;) 
On your way there you have to drive for a while on a single-lane small road with tunnels (max 3,3m) so this is a spot for smaller vehicles (like a car with rooftop tent).

name: CAMPING HELLESYLT
description: Beautiful spot near the fjord, very calm. Nearby as the ferry to Geiranger. Free check out time, showers by coins (10nok/4min). Price 220 without electricity or 275, with electricity per caravan plus 50nok per person.

name: Stord Dumping Station
description: Fresh water and dumping station. Free to use

name: Good Mexican Street food
description: AWESOME food! You simply cannot miss this place! Genuine Mexican food, street tacos, and amazing personnel. Also good to support local businesses.

name: Epledal
description:
Gravel Parking Space for a small beach with pit toilet, Picknick bench/table, fire place. 
You have to follow a long and narrow gravel street. Not for big vans, perfect for rooftop tents.

name: Øye parking
description:
Parking with a good view of the fjord and the mountains. There's an outhouse and running water with a hose. 50kr for a car, 150kr for motorhome.
Very nice spot next to a quiet town.
Would recommend

name: Øye kai
description: Nice warm shower with toilet and mirror.

name: flekkefjord
description: Along gravel road, good access, even room for a caravan, very quiet, only one place but more along this road, remote, no traffic

name: spot next to river
description: Field next to river with place for atleast 4 cars. In spring river is loud but u get used to this.  fire place.

name: Fiske Plass river camp
description: fiske plass. place for 2 cars with tents. next to river. fire place.

name: Camp by water
description: Nice camp spot by The water, close to a gravel road. There is a 50NOK road toll

name: Mountain Wally camp
description: Nice camp with running water, need 4x4 to get there. If not there is a spot 100meters down.

name: Quiet spot next to a river
description:
Very nice spot, perfect to camp, swim or enjoy the sun. Can fit 2 maybe 3 cars/rvs.
Just take a little road off route 9, it becomes gravel but it's not to rocky. Pretty close to the road but almost can't hear it due to the river coming in close to the sites. Spent 2 beautiful days there without any problems.
Oh and there are cute beavers coming out at night!!

name: Lakeside Camping (no vehicle access)
description: No vehicle access. A nice flat spot on the shore of a lake for a few tents with a fire places and tables.

name: Storavatnet camp (only bicycles)
description:
Note: only for cyclists/hikers.
For people arriving in Bergen after cycling/hitchhiking, this is a decent place to camp. It’s within a public park, but there are no signs that camping is not allowed. Pit toilet near the ‘beach’. Some people spending the Thursday evening here having dinner or just chilling. After 22:30 everyone was gone. Quiet night, only the sounds of water, wind and birds. Only accessible by bike or foot.

name: Gorningen
description: Established site with some parking possibilities along the road or on a established parking. Beautiful view and historical site to see.

name: Legå Camping
description: Small campsite near a lake. Fishing and swimming in the water are allowed and there are a couple of small boats that can be rented. There are marked pitches to park up in with plenty of space for large vehicles. We paid 320 NOK for non-electric space, with electricity it was 400 NOK. Shower is 10 NOK for 3 minutes.

name: BicycleRepairCafe (Camp)
description: Free Bicycle Repair Cafe for bicycle travelers only. Possibility for putting up tent or Hammock. Free WiFi, Water, Electricity. Please contact me before any visit to make sure I'm around. Normally open 7 days a week, all year. I speak English, Dutch, German, Norwegian and  Klingon. Welcome for all ages, all genders, any nationality. Mobile phone for contact: +4740469135 (WhatsApp, Text or just call me)

name: Forus Bilverksted
description:
a really good mechanic. we sent an email and the day after they called us. they gave us an appointment for the day after. 
they managed to make a diagnostic and change our starter and your fan beld in one day. 
amazing job for our camper van (6m / 2,6m)

name: Beach
description: Fantastic grassy spot to pitch a tent and watch the midnight sun. Gravel parking for vans also. Along a gravel/sandy track.

name: Tranquility Bay
description: beautiful quiet beach with grassy hills to camp on just above the beach. beautiful sunset spot and crystal clear ocean! space for tents on the grass and RVs on the informal parking lot

name: Kiste
description: Nice parking place at the end of a dirt road. Quit and a lot of trees.

name: Secluded Spot on hill in the Woods
description:
There is a small dirttrack that takes of between the trees and up a small hill in a bit of a curve, so no long or exceptionally high vehicules possible, but 2wd totally doable . In the Woods there is a Small opening with a grassy field, picknick table an fireplace (Not when open fires are Prohibited because of dryness). There is also a Small wooden stage so I think they have music here sometimes, but looks rarely used. Around the there Are nice MTB trails.

Stayed here one Night for early Windsurfing on the beach (good parking close to the Beach at Surf Lista on Haviksanden beach). 

Here there Are No amenities, but nice and hidden from the Road and room for multiple vehicules.
Please keep this Little Gem clean and clean up After yourself (also white Paper After a pie and the such) Otherwise this will be the next Place with a “Camping Forbut” sign, like prettymuch anywhere along the Beach These days.

name: LPG Norge
description: Filling station for propane gas bottles with friendly service

name: Hytte Camp
description: You can camp there - also have single room cabins with shared bathrooms and small kitchen. If too cold to camp. Clean and affordable - I paid €43/night.

name: Storfjord kommune
description:
One of the best budget places I’ve stayed at in Europe. I paid $35/night for a room with 4 beds. Single occupancy. Communal showers - hot, and shared bathrooms. Wifi. Kitchen and recreation area.

The property used to be an army barracks, then taken over by a construction firm for a project - then converted into commercial living quarters. Secure parking on private property for all types of vehicles.

It is huge and the best value.

Call Trine +47 918 09 449 to make arrangements.
Address is (Nordlysveien 3463, Storfjord kommune, Troms og Finnmark 9143, Norway)

name: Wild camp by the river.
description: A couple of flat ish places down by the river to pitch a tent. Also gravel parking by the road for cars and vans.

name: Sjømannskirken Narvik
description:
Hostel at a church. Cafe attached. Clean, quiet, communal showers, bathroom, kitchen. Private secure parking for bikes. I ended up in a 12 bed dorm. Good enough while passing through.
I paid $28/night.

name: Off the road camp spot.
description: Level grass and gravel spaces for tents and vans. Okay spot for one night for morning ferry. Be selective where you pitch your tent and some areas are dry riverbed.

name: Grendahuken
description: In case of rain, can stay dry.I didn't sleep. h

name: Motonor AS
description: Motorcycle repair shop. Excellent service place and friendly owner. Walk-in tire service - I swapped a rear tire. Has access to wide range of parts and accessories.

name: Krokstand
description:
Verry nice place to camp for one night. In front of a nice beach.
You can find toiletts, tape water and outside cold showers. 
Camping table.

There is a small snack - kiosque close to the beach.
if the owner tell you it's forbiden to camp you can move your tente 100 meters on the forest and it's will be good. if not enjoy of the grass !!!

name: Beach Camp
description:
Wonderful place to watch the sunset (or not in mid summer)
Fire pit and wind break for shelter 
New compost toilet in carpark.

name: Flat land near lake
description: Flat grass area off gravel farm track. Suitable for tents and vans, near lake side.  There are a few options round the East side of the swimming lake.

name: BBQ area by the river.
description:
Great places next to river for a tent or van. Two tables, fire pit and 3 sided shelter. 
Down a dirt track. 
Also more space further down the track 
Shown on Google as bbq area. 
 Little to no road noise.

name: Blafjell hundesenter fjellhotell
description:
Nice new hotel with beautiful views. Friendly owner. It is also a dog training place. Private rooms and bathrooms, shared kitchen living areas. Clean and secure parking for all  types of vehicles. I paid $50/night.
Address is; 149 Blåfjellvegen, Mosjøen, 8664, Norway
Tel; +47 916 32 210

name: knapptjernet
description:
shelter with firepit and a lake. 
perfect for adv riders or road trip.

name: One night stop over.
description:
Off the road down a short track to a couple of benches and fire pit. 
Toilet in Carpark. 
Good for one night between ferries. 
Some flat spots to pitch tent down by the water.

name: FiestaVikings
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description added by owner.

Fellow overlander, here if not travelling. Can be of assistance. Small garage suited for bikers to park inside and bed to sleep.

name: Hendriks Hytte
description:
Cabins in the woods. Clean, simple, secure parking for vehicles. Perfect for night stop over for motocyclists. Some places have kitchen.
I paid 600 NOK/night.
Call +47 96725405.

name: Ride Tronhine Yamaha
description: Motor cycles tires and repairs, they helped me out with new tires off the shelf (I removed the wheels and refitted them to save time and money.

name: Beautifull panoramic gravel road with places to sidecamp
description:
(NOTE: possible half way impassible due to snow, Even up in to half of July, then you have to reverse to turn, but road is good)
To reach this Road be mindful not to take the tunnel but the old road around the mountain to the Right just before the tunnel. 
This track branches off from the old (but still maintained) road. I had to plow through some snow banks with one side of the car. Then the road is gravel and some Stones, but nothing a 2wd can’t handle. Along the mountainside Are some washout parts so be careful. That's where it becomes impassible when still snow (See picture) 
River down below for water and magnificent view! Some tents along the first Part from hikers.
Looks bigger rig friendly, but can’t see all the way to the end.

name: lakeside 4x4 campspot
description: 4x4 is needed! Small vehicles only. VW T5 is okay. Not bigger. Small fire pit with a beautiful view on the lake

name: Hostel Oslofjord
description: Variety of accommodations available shared baths or private. I had twin beds and private bath. Breakfast included. Friendly helpful staff. Walking distance to bus tops. Food and groceries a bit far. Secure parking for bikes and 24 hr checkin. I paid $60/night.

name: Silent camp with View of Dønnamannen and Syv søstre
description: Nice quiet spot the dog can run free , hike trails close by.view of Dønnamannen and Syv Søstre

name: Solvang Camping
description:
Campground with huts for rent, places for caravans and tents, kitchen available with plenty of seating space, friendly personnel and everything is clean.
Supermarket at 4 km distance
290 NOK for 2 persons/2 motorcycles/1 tent

name: Kirkeporten Camping
description:
Small campground with huts for rent, parking spots for caravans and a small space for tents 
There is a small Restaurant with pizza, fish soup and reindeer saute, a kitchen and washing machine with dryer. 
Facilites are clean.

name: Lake side spot
description: No Internet, just a parking space at a beautiful Lake! Needs some time to get there

name: Lake Tadjafalnet
description:
Beautiful free Site in the middle of nowhere, no Services,suitable for all kind of campers.
Drive is easy, some steep inclines.
Even cellphone reception

name: offroad view to preikestolen
description: Its a Rocky road just a couple Meters away from the street

name: Runde island
description: Very beautifull spot at Runde. We thought it is much better than the crowded  campsite. Also available for bigger campers. Some spots to pitch your tent.

name: Camp next to the pond
description: At the end of a gravel road through the forest, very calm, only some local fisherman came by

name: Storvannet NAF Camping
description:
Nice Campground by the water (Swimming possible) with quiet Place for tents, room for caravans and small huts to rent 
Owner is super friendly 
15-20 min walk to city center, where you can meet reindeer 
Our tent was visited by a reindeer

name: One of few spots on Lovund.
description: Enough place for 6-7cars if parked properly. Nice toilet close by at the small local soccer stadium.

name: Skibotn Camping
description:
Campground with cabins for rent, space for caravans and tents
Kitchen with eating area
Showers require coins (Kronen)
Restaurant with pizza and burgers on the other side of the street. 
The tent area is directly by the street and the seagulls seem to be very talkative here, so it is not the most quiet of places but we liked it anyways.

name: harbour camping
description:
small campground mostly for rvs
great view over the fjord

name: On a hill
description: On top of a hill, many places here. Some goats around. Haven’t seen or heard anyone besides that, giving I put my tent up just next to the road. Believe it’s a dead end, with a spectacular view. But not for me as it was rainy and cloudy all the time I have been here. There is a small toll to get here.

name: Øya økocamp
description:
Respectable camping with a sustainable profile. Nice tent and motorhome pitches both in the developed area (completely without pesticides) and in the forest on the island. Small nice cabins with 2 and 4 bunk beds. Clean and new sanitary facilities. Has its own charger for electric cars. Located along the river and has the famous Skjåk wave at its base. Wifi-free zone with good 5G coverage. Good hiking opportunities nearby in both Jotunheimen, Breheimen and Reinheimen. The campsite host helps you find the perfect trip for you.
Updated prices can be found on the campsite's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/oya.camping

name: Communal picnic area with shelter & benches (for cyclists)
description: Large grassy area with shelter, benches and table where you can pitch a tent. Seems to be a communal space (Rotary?), but it hasn’t been properly looked after for a while. But very OK for 1 night. There’s a light barrier at the entrance, so only suitable for cyclists. A supermarket is situated directly opposite of it (with toilet & drinking water). You can hear the noise from the street, but it’s quite calm at night. We spent a very good night here!

name: Gassy area by the side of the road.
description: Right next to the road grassy area, busy ish during the evening, near to water. Okay for one night if arriving late leaving early.

name: Near swim spot.
description: Down a gravel track, pass the swimming area (no camping) there are a few great spots to pitch a tent near the water, also good for vans. Only drawback is it’s near the railway, so loud when the trains go past hourly until about midnight ish. Fire pits and lake water.

name: Small river
description: A mostly good gravel road let me here; a large mostly flat surface. a car needs some ground clearance to get here. a small creek runs along site it. Very silent ar night.

name: Evenestangen kystbatteri
description: Parking lot with the sea view, nice spot with banches and some fire places next to the sea. You can fish there.

name: Ry Herberge og Gjesteård
description:
A really lovely place with a cafe and accomodation. 
It is right on the pilgrimage route. 
Run by very sweet people.

name: Skaia
description: Hard ground, only available for overlanders. secluded but not very nice scenery, up the road there are better places near the lake and Skaiå.

name: Haugsjasund camping
description: Nice small camping near the road at a lake.

name: Morudsytanda
description: Nice Norwegian camping at the river. Small field for tents. Mainly caravans and campers and fixed places. Really nice facilities for a dry shelter.

name: Lake Svartvatnet
description:
Stayed here without problems. Definitely not accessible for Cars but a decent alternative for Bikepackers if you don't want to put up your tent in the parking lot close to this. There's a lot of hikers in the morning and you'll definitely hear them but this is a bit secluded and nobody came here.

Pack in what you pack out, leave no trace but footprints.

name: next to river with waterfall view
description: Plenty space for campers and tents with natuerell water source.

name: Kongsvinger Campsite
description: Free campsite for campers next to a beautiful lake where you can swim. There are Public toilets and waste bins.

name: Flothyl camping
description: old camping where you can just come here and for 500- 700 a Hut you can just stay for the night.  Yes, it depends, there is also a camping site where you can set up your tent.

name: JUTUL BBQ area.
description:
Further on from where all the campers park and down a gravel road there is a fantastic shelter with tables, firepit overlooking a field. 
Great place to pitch a tent for a night. 
Sign welcomes and reminds to take rubbish away with you. 
So many raspberries to pick was a great bonus.

name: Little lake
description:
Close to a little lake, you hear cars passing by.
Small fire pit

name: Mountain Views between Tuddal and Rujkan.
description:
Fantastic spot for a still summers evening. 
Many places off the road to pitch a tent if you’re happy to walk a bit. Also a few gravel areas for vans. Amazing views!

name: Rullestad Camping
description:
Nice camping with a lot of accommodation, it has a self check-in/out machine.
250NOK for Tent/Overlander without electricity.
Washing machine 50NOK
Shower 20NOK for 5 minuts (i thought)
For Tent/Overlander nice positions overlooking the lake.
Very good for good shower and clean clothes.

name: next to gravel road
description: Great place to stand for 1 night.  Nearby is a small running stream with clear water.  Quiet spot.  You can hear a little bit the main road.

name: Søndagsmyrdammen
description: Open cabin for the public to stay for free, simple standard, some wood benches to sleep on and a firepit in the middle.  Small BBQ hut. Caravan parking. This place is run by Statskog. A few km on gravel road from the main road. Its a toll fee on the gravel road for cars and caravans.

name: Fishing spot at lake
description: Parking lot for fishing lake. Enough space for bigger campervans. Also many beautiful spots for tents, a bit further down. The lake is also great for swimming.

name: Roadside
description:
This is a paved dead end. You have a nice view of many mountains. You can easily pitch Dome tents.  Stay For the Night With your mobile. No water etc.
Good 4G cell coverage.

name: Small gravel place next to the river
description: Spot where locals get their small boats in or out of the water. Flat gravel spot is large enough for two large campers. The terrain next to it is too muddy and stoney for tents.

name: Wild camp near the lake
description: Nice place , morning sun but alot of ants

name: Dump station behind the Joker supermarket
description: Dump station behind the joker supermarket on a very large parking lot. The joker has also a small children’s playground next to the store

name: Storvikseter Camping
description:
Nice and tiny campingground at the fields. You Van stay With tent, caravan of book a little house.
You have fresh water, a shower and an outhouse.
I paid 80 NOK For one night With shower etc.

name: Kynna
description: Nica place, with dry toilet, sitting/sleeping place, fireplace and swimming bridge.

name: Wildcamp at Lake Høvringsvatne.
description:
Really on the lake shore, this spot is beautyfull although well visited. By car, this is roughly how far you can go. Here, on the northwestern tip of the lake you have a perfect view over the lake. 
Yep; no amenities in sight, although you can walk (5 minutes) to the nearby hotel for a visit of their toilet. When we were here, 3 other campers stayed the night. A few meters further is a small parking lot with room for approx. 15 campers. But we preferred to spend the night really close to the water.

name: Rotneblikk
description: Little open cabin with fireplace. nice view on theblake. Right on the side of TET Norway.

name: Swimming lake, suitable for camping
description:
Swimming area with benches, fire pits and toilets. Large parking with no vehicle access to the water. Caravan and camper van parking restricted between 24h - 06h. 
Many tent spots a short walk (within a few minutes) from the parking area. There are wooded areas or beach areas. Great for a hammock also. Quiet overnight, no road noise.

name: Open place in the forest
description:
Open and flat. Only sheep live here, so tie your dog if you have one and don’t leave food. 
Almost no traffic on the road.

name: Wildcamp at Lake Mefjellsvatnet
description: Situated some 30 above the lake, direct next to the gravel road, this quiet place offers a beautifull view on the lake, some snowy patches and, when the clouds vanish, the glaciers across on the opposite side of the next valley. A bit windy at times.

name: Tindeveien
description: Nice quiet gravel parking close to road. Not much traffic though. Room for maybe 5 campers or more. Even for few tents too but it’s rocky ground so it can be tricky. Many small places for campers along this road. No phone reception at all. You need to pay 90 NOK to take this road.

name: Small parking spot a bit away from the main road
description: A little bit away from the main road on a unpaved (gravel) road that is good accessible with a larger camper. Directly next to a small river stream

name: Old runway
description:
This is the old runway of Væroy so lots of space with beautiful view over the sea. Even during high season (when we were there) there is enough space to feel a bit off grid. At least compared to the other parts of the Lofoten... 

It is basically free but they ask a contribution for the community which you can only pay with VIPPS. A bit further down there is a parking (not allowed to camp there) with toilets, fresh water and a sanitary dump. Also many spots for tents.

name: Place by the river
description: A sand and stone beach by the river. 4x4 needed. It’s far from the road so there is no noise.

name: Nice place by the river
description: Stone beach by the river. A perfect place!

name: Odden Dock
description: Gravel parking at fresh water dock. Flat surface for caravan/roof tent parking. Do not park in front of private road in the end of the parking area. Portapotty toilet and bathing place, benches and a firepit. Sun until late in the evening. Might be populated during daytime.

name: off the road
description:
right next to thw road. road is hearable, but the place can not be seen. duribg the night silent. firespot around. 
tents and bug rigs possible.

name: Sunny spots by the lake.
description:
Gravel track off road with 3 different places to pitch down by the water.  Also large turning area at the end of track. 
Shallow water great for a paddle. 
Lovely sunny spot with great sunsets and lots of blueberries.

name: Place of dreams
description: Dreamy campsite with a stunning view of a waterfall. There’s two options here for camping with a tent: the actual Place of Dreams with gravel on the east side of the road, and towards the river is this spot with a small fireplace and space for a tent and vehicle. River bank is high but there is a lower spot where you can access the water. Rallerwegen bikers pass by here all day, but otherwise very quiet road.

name: dump/water
description:
Dump and potable water available here for free + trash cans

Place pour vidange eaux usées et eau de rinçage et eau potable + poubelles

name: Voss Fredspark
description: Small parking for a few cars next to a museum -like place and very close to a lake and same trails.

name: Furøy Camping
description: Really nice campground right by the water with cabins and space for lots of tents and RVs. Paid 250nok for a single tent, unlimited hot showers included. Really clean facilities with multiple washing machines, dryers, a kitchen and also nice staff.

name: By the lake
description: Nice place for one vehicle or a tent. We camped here with car and a rooftop tent. It is near the road but there was no traffic at night.

name: Sognsveien 231 Parking
description: Oficial Parking Space, at the end of Metro line 5, very spatious, suitable for cars and caravans, Long and short (No trucks). No services available but great Spice, stayed here for two nights in early August.

name: Kvithella Beach - camping vehicles strictly forbidden
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: One night of successful tent camping does not imply that it is allowed.

Beautiful little spot right by the water overlooking Nesna. Close to the road, which is very quiet during the night, though. Sign by entrance specifically states no overnight parking for RVs but doesn't say anything about tents, and I also had no trouble staying here in my tent, despite a few locals using this place in the morning.

name: Lindesnes Fyr
description:
Big gravel parking lot, at night time space for 50 Motorhomes.
You have to pay for it.

name: Barentszzee overlooking the fjord
description: Plenty of places for tents overlooking the sea.

name: On top of the sand dune
description:
Stayed here with my tent just after the ferry. Bit of a steep gravel road to get to and soft ground at the spot, so maybe only possible with 4x4 after rain?

There is plenty of space for tents and a few cars, not 100% sure if it's private property or if camping is allowed.

name: Entrance parking Vårsætergrenda
description:
This is a parking spot where it is allowed to park overnight for free near Lillehammer, it has some great views and is located pretty good i think. It's silent and gets the evening sun too. 

It is encouraged to be somewhat descreet, low noise, dogs MUST be on a leash, take everything with you (trash and poop) etc, dont use the neighbours trash cans that is placed nearby

The parking spot is very popular in day time by locals, so it can get full during the day

There have been plenty car campers here the last years, and the locals report little trash, almost no toilet paper blowing in the wind,  generally no problems. Everyone is happy :)
LNT principles apply


This space popped up on google maps as a public campground, which is misleading at best. So as a local I am taking charge and wish you welcome!

name: Parking spot with awesome views
description: Large enough for three campers or a few cars that we used to sit through a few rainy days with awesome views. No traffic but a few cars per day.

name: Behind ferry house
description:
Nice little grassy place with seven spots for RVs (including power) and a couple of smaller tents.
80nok for a tent, and you get a key to use a well maintained and clean bathroom + the ferry waiting room after it closes.
Beautiful views as well, but obviously, you'll get ferry noises when it runs.
Next to a small convenienc store and a restaurant. Ask the staff about access.

name: Piazzola ex cava
description: Spot near the street Inside the forest. The floor is soft. For entry go up and turn right in the forest

name: Fisher place
description: Picknick area with playground, bbq places, toilette. A lot of space for campers next to the E6. At night silent.

name: Surprise near the street
description: Right after the tunnel in the corner on the right. Good place to park. After a few meters nice flat area. Well place for tents as well. Nice view on the sea and the mountains.

name: Idillic spot for a tent.
description:
One of our favourite spots all summer. If you’re traveling by MC or bike you can get the off the gravel road and up a path. 
There is a table under shelter and fire pit. 
Just one spot down but the lake for a tent. 
Perfect for a swim and a fish with a permit. 
Please leave it better than you found it so it can continue to be enjoy.

name: Shelter near Kristiansand
description: Big shelter with a fireplace and there is a river nearby. No vehicles allowed on the street up here.

name: Karasjohka
description: Small road going down from the main road to the Karasjohka river - boarder between Finland and Norway. Beautiful sandbank (August) and possible to swim along the shore of the river - be aware of the current! Campfire.

name: Drinking water and a toilet near Mandal
description:
Drinking water and a toilet near Mandal.

Drinking water is on the right-hand outside of the building.

name: lago
description: very small parquing whit w.c. por une nigth along 17

name: Gol Propan LPG Norge
description: Very helpfull man and reasonable price. We filled up our small propane bottle (2,5kg gas weight) for NOK123.

name: rest area
description: Nice rest area with tables, toilets, and access to small lake.

name: Inside the forest
description: Nice little spot inside the forest ! Perfect for bike packer. You have to walk a bit next to your bike to come here. A bit noisy because of the highway

name: Bogen , at the lake
description: beautifull small lakeside. outdoor gym. garbage bins.close to the village. reccomandable. place for  5 vans

name: Polar Park/Arctic Wildlife Center
description:
hot shower. 50NOK for just the shower or for free if you stay over night(250NOK without or 300NOK with electricity)
Ask at the reception for the Passcode

name: Wild spot at troll park
description:
This spot is just behind the parking of the  old troll park. It's a bit more private than the car park. From here a 1km path starts towards a beautiful lake. This path is not allowed for cars but at the lake there are lots of spots for tents. 

At the car park there is enough space for big rigs. Also fresh water and a sanitary dump station is available at the car park.

The troll park is closed due to a fire but you can still visit it. Great for children.

name: Nothaugen Camping
description: Clean and modern facilities with space for RVs and tents. Tents cost 150nok/night and showers cost 12nok/5min. This Camprgound is all about fishing, so they have a drying room for clothing, which I was allowed to use for my wet tent in the morning. There's a small kitchen and multiple cabins as well.

name: Close to the lighthouse
description:
Awesome spot for tents.
Close to the shore and the light house.
Large green area, a few sheep, only very rocky access to the sea.

A little infrastructure, 2 picnic tables, a shelter under construction (no roof yet).

No access for cars, but great for hikers and cyclists.

name: Place by the lake
description: small place for tent or small camper(van). alongside gravelroad. alongside a lake, bench and fireplace.

name: Beachcamp
description:
small road downwards, suitable for every vehicle. Then big beach with beautifull view. two fireplaces.
easely fits multiple vehicles

name: Uno-X
description: place to refill gas and change gas bottles

name: Alvleinsvika beach
description: Camping spot on the beach, enough parking space for 3-4 cars a short walk away. Be careful of the tide, was a couple of meters from our tent at high tide but could be an issue of it's stormy.

name: Public BBQ
description: Big gravel carpark and grassy area suitable for at least 20 vehicles. Pit toilets and rubbish bins. We'll located not far from Andalsnes with a beautiful view over the mountains

name: Kvinesdal/Flekkesfjord
description: Max 24 hours. Great views. Parking with toilets and running water. There are benches and all.

name: Røssåga
description:
Nice little wooden kiosque with fire place, table, benches. spots for tents. Suitable for motorbikes if ground not too muddy (trail 50m long) 
It seems to be a gathering place for fishers. river just behind it. 

Respect the place :)

name: Skorovatn
description: Clean Dump Station and fresh water. Not sure if is drinking water or not. Only portable Toilette dumping possible. No built in grey or black water Tanks.

name: Levajok Lodge
description:
A lovely place with huts, cabins and camping available. Just on the river looking over Finland. Ideal if you are crossing the border between Norway and Finland as only approx 80km from the border on the way to Nordkapp.

Restaurant, well equipped communal kitchen, showers and lounge. Free washing. Near the road but peaceful

name: Tretterud Sport avd Torpo (Bicycle)
description: Best bicycle mechanic around in the area.

name: Spot next to the river (two wheel and hike only)
description:
Small clearing in the forest. There is a forest road leading from the road directly to this spot. The road is blocked with stones, so only two-wheelers and hiker.

Sometimes there runs a train on the other side of the river but not too frequent.

name: truck parking GOL
description: Huge parking area for trucks at the river (and train). Super market opposite. Free very clean hot showers and toilets. Very recommendable for one night.

name: Lake Gakkarjavri
description: Amazing spot to wild camp with a RTT (roof top tent - moderator). A shelter, picnic tables, fire pit, wet wood, toilet and just on the lake bed. A local fisherman spit with little boats. No "no camping" signs. Had a peaceful safe sleep. Great panorama and lake to swim in. 4g comes and goes.

name: place in wood close to waterfall
description: big open space alongside quiet gravel road. 500m uphill small parking next to top of the waterfall. there was a toll sign, yet no way to pay it. only downside. no sun in the morning

name: wildcamping in the woods
description: Small camp, fits one or two cars, 4x4, van. 2x firepit. Alongside beautifull (toll) gravelroad with stunning view. Soft ground (yet accessible without 4x4), great for tents.

name: Espenes
description: Parking place next to scenic route 13, with place for 6 - 8 RVs. Toilets available. Also covered picknick benches are present, so even with bad weather you can eat outdoors. Grass field for tents is also present.

name: Tvinde Camping
description: Campsite beautiful situated directly at the waterfall north of Voss. Tvide Camping is simply paid for at the kiosk. It is best to change shower coins/washing machine (each 10 crowns coins) here.

name: bench and firepit alongside the road
description: small place for tent/small campervan with bench and firepit. road is hardly used. small path 10mtrs to small river

name: bobilparkering
description: parking for rv. with tap for water and Grey water.

name: tungestolen
description: Wildcamping at the end of a tolroad (70 kronen) nice place for a lot of campers or tents. There is a compost toilet and natural source water. From this place you can do a hike to the gletjer

name: Wildcamp near Nusfjord
description: The spot is just outside Nusfjord near a lake. There are several potential spots along the trail. Be aware that during and after rainfall the area is very moist, since it is a wetland. Preferably camp further away from the lake on the other side of the trail. Nusfjord has no real grocery store but an expensive bakery. Because it is a heritage town, entrance fee into town is 100 NOK per person.

name: Ramberg
description: The camp spot is just outside Ramberg directly at the shore. Keep all food secured because there are weasels living under the rocks close by, but they were only curious when we were camping there. You can get potable water from Ramberg's store, center washroom.

name: Selfjord
description: The spot is close to a mountain cabin. Be aware of small biting flies. Walking along the shoreline further into the fjord, there is a small area where it is possible to enter the water.

name: Horseid Beach
description: There is a big plateau right at the shoreline with many (~10-15) spots for tents on grass. The beach itself is massive. There is a water spring close by coming from the mountainside as well as a lake. We filtered/boiled the spring water and drank it. It is a beautiful place. Go visit if you have the chance.

name: Lofoten Hostel Ballstad
description: Very friendly staff and lovely fisher cabins to sleep in. Right at the water. They have a rowing boat you can use to get to Ballstad Island and the shop, bars and restaurants that are located there. We paid 680 NOK for two people and one night.

name: Stokkvika
description: If you descend from the mountain pass coming from Å down to the lake you follow a small trail on the left shore of the lake. The trail is not easy and may be slippery after rain. It might be possible to wade on the shoreline through the water but we followed the trail. The campsite is just above the ocean shore. Be aware of hidden holes in the ground since the rocks are only loosely covered with vegetation and dirt. Perfect spot for sunsets. The lake is really refreshing.

name: Lake Stokkvikvatnet
description: Camp spot right at the shore of Lake Stokkvikvatnet. Very beautiful. We didn't stay here but went further on the trail along the lake to the Ocean for an even better spot. But the trail is not so nice. So for bad weather I would recommend this spot here.

name: At the end of E10
description: This spot is above the ocean with an amazing view. It is outside of the "camping forbidden" area which you can find on the map at the parking lot. It is also slightly hidden from view from Å.

name: Skarsvåg tourist centre
description:
Cute little fishing village 3km from main road leading to nordkapp. Also a good walk from the church in a loop to the arch window.
Shower kr50. Also a washing machine but I did not use it. Should be a few places where to camp too but I slept at the parking in Nordkapp.
Little bar serving food and you can also see the king crab here in an aquarium

name: Voss gas
description: Rare place to fill up propane tanks and they have multiple adapters for sale.

name: Lakeside fisherman's spot
description: accessable via fisher's parking. parking itself also possible. drive a little further downhill (cars, campervan's only) and you can park alongside the water. Small fire pit. road visable but few traffic

name: nature reserve wetlands
description: A small nature reserve with wetlands parking just off E9. Small parking with toilet and then nice walks to wetlands area. Benches, firepit, shelter by the wetlands (no cars). No no camping signs so just parked at the parking that only takes about 12 cars so not good in high season. Peaceful woods around. Locals walking, running etc during the day

name: Hidden spot next to the beach
description: The spot is just above the beach and hidden from the road. Its only a small spot but we managed to fit with a three person tent. The ground is not entirely flat though

name: Elevated place lakeside
description: Nice elevated place between lake and road. two picnic tables. Gas station and supermarket nearby (Skaiå), actual public toilet across the road. Acces for all vehicles.

name: Small shelter in the forrest
description:
Small shelter in the forrest, with two benches, a table and a fireplace. One of the benches is a litte bit short, but if you put on your legs it is ok for one night.

Cell phone signal is available.

name: Small shelter in the Forrest
description:
Small shelter in the Forrest with two benches, a table and a furnace. One of the benches is a little bit short.

Cellphone reception is available.

name: Shelter next to the sea and a river
description:
Shelter next to the sea and a river. There are four picnic tables a toilet and trash cans available. 

Cell Phone reception is available

name: Awesome spot next to a lake in a small Forrest
description:
Awesome spot next to a lake in a small Forrest.

There is a shelter nearby (next to the gravel path).

Cell phone reception available.

name: Shelter
description:
Shelter in the Forrest. 

cell phone reception is available.

name: Grøntanlegget
description: Really nice place by the lake with benches trees and heaps of space. Parking for motorised vehicles is forbidden but no information about putting up a tent. Right by the road, which is super quiet in the evening, some locals in the morning, but they did not mind me sleeping here.

name: Multiple campspots near lake
description: Walk or ride down after parking lot and there are multiple places for your adventure motorcycle holiday. patches of grass and improvised campfires are , possible to walk down to lake.

name: Parking
description: Nice parking lot at a lake, good for camping!

name: Setskog Parking
description: Nice parking next to a lake. Fire rings available

name: Tentcamping only Gapahuk Svullrya
description: Nice little place for tents next to the river (lake) with a shelter.

name: Only for tents.  Halsjøen Beach
description: Beautiful beach at Halsjøen lake. Only for tents.

name: Creek camp
description: Beautiful spot next to a small and clear creek. No vehicle access

name: Sømåa River camp
description: Beautiful spot next to Sømåa river which is full of trout!

name: Patruslia Huts
description:
Very nice and cozy cabins next to a horse farm. There are two big cabins available (for 4 persons) and cost 850 kr./night. 

Friendly owner!

name: Marienborg Camping
description:
Nice campsite next to a lake. 
20 kr./5 min. shower
100 kr. per night for 2 persons with a tent and bicycles.

name: Vikhammer park
description:
Park for Discgolf next to Trondheimfjord. There were people around but it was no problem with our tent. 

Toilet at the parking lot

name: Gangåsvatnet
description: Good spot at beautiful Gangåsvatnet, but with car noise.

name: Tromvik picnic spot
description:
A small picnic area on the way to the harbor. Picnic table, BBQ, fire pit and some very wet wood.
Space and flat enough for 2 medium sized vehicles. Just by a river and just off the main road, but it is barely used. Even saw some northern light activity due to clear sky but also a full moon and street lights so not 100% ideal. Good 4g

name: Lanternen Camping
description:
Nice camping next to a road and the sea. Very nice owner. 
Good kitchen, but bad internet.
Good fishing possibilities!

20 kr./ 10 min. shower
150 kr./ night camper
80 kr./ night tent

name: Botnen Camping
description:
Beautiful camping next to Sognefjord with beautiful spots. Owners a bit unfriendly but okay.

Prices for tents: 160 kr./night 

Fishing was very good!

name: Under the bridge
description: Campspot under the bridge at Leversund...

name: Best view in the world
description: Rest place with picknick tables with a view of the lake and gletsjer, nice route to reach. public toilet house. Next to the road. We have not (yet) camped here, but will return.

name: Roadside rest stop
description: Three level, paved sites with picnic tables.   Traffic noise near by.   Close to ferry terminal.

name: Lakeside lay by
description: Small area between the highway and the lake.   Room for three campervans.   Picnic table.   Great views.

name: Shelter at Varangerbotn Sami museum
description: New modern shelter opposite the Sami museum in town. Fireplace and firewood available. Stream just behind the car park. In town, so not that quiet due to traffic noise. No toilet - gas station across the road can be used

name: Municipal water/Dump station
description: No charge, clean, excellent facility.   Drinking water, sewage dump.

name: king of the world place
description: little Dutch courage for the hike and you have a wild camp spot

name: Next to river ridge
description:
Tent only 
Between the rocks next to the bridge and the river
1.7km from Dombas

name: Wild camp overlooking Varangerdjord
description: Just past Vadsø this is a good spot for a small tent, out of sight of the road and overlooking the sea. The town of Vadsø has a shelter that is not too appealing, so if you push past town this is a good option. There are sections where campers/RVs pull in, but closer to the sea there is a drop down which is good concealment for a tent if travelling by bicycle. No water source, so stick up in advance. Some passing traffic at night but camp spot is totally hidden.

name: Roadside pull off
description: Beautiful, paved, level site beside the fjord.   Picnic tables and garbage can.   Incredible views.   Very little traffic at night.

name: Vadsö
description: Nice place for several motorhomes. Nice view over the city. Quiet, no trafic in the night. Dumpstation an fresh water, all for free. It is also possible to descharge builtin tanks.

name: Vadsö
description: New, clean dumpstation. Easy acces. Free

name: Municipal parking in Hornindal
description: A nice paved lot beside the lake with terrific views, hotel with restaurant 50 meters, 24 hour public washrooms 100 meters with black water dump station.

name: Kiberg shelter
description: New modern shelter in village of Kiberg. Overlooking the beach and beside river for fresh water. Possible to place small tent inside shelter or beside if needed. Parking space for bigger vans.

name: awesome place
description: amazing clean place with two fire pits, two tables and great fishing spot. easy to find.. for big rigs you must back up 90m to the dock parking lot...

name: water toilet and dump station
description:
dump and water station
easy to dump Grey water and get fresh water

name: #akvakultur excursion
description: An amazing experience into salmon farming. Great presentation and boat trip out to the pens. 150kr at 10am, call in advance or book online. There is space for about 7 campers. They do not mind you sleeping here if you are doing the tour. Well worth it.

name: Skjerneset Bryggecamping
description:
Nicely informal campsite, mostly small places surrounded by some pineyrees. Directly on the sea shore. 
This used to be a small fish factory/ harbour, you can use the jouse for cooking and sit in several living rooms. Also you can walk around the building as a little museum. 
Very friendly owner. 
Clean, very quiet.

name: Laksforsen
description: Large paved lot beside a restaurant and gift shop.   Overlooks a beautiful waterfall.

name: Haverringen
description: Small parking area for four or five campervans.   Beside a lake with mountain view.   Very quiet.  No fee but donation welcome to the adjoining community hall.

name: Big parking next to the dok
description: big parking lot next to the dok. with shower clean toalet we paid 300nok but nobody controled anything

name: Tysfjord Hotel
description: Hotel, restaurant, fuel pumps and supply store.   For a charge of 200 nok you can park behind the hotel by the sea.  Very quiet.   Excellent food in the restaurant.   Free access to WC, washer/dryer and shower.

name: Washing machines and 24hr supermarket
description:
little self service supermarket, you can always get in. 
by the toilets there is a washing machine and dryer

name: Steinkjer
description:
Place to fill your gass bottles quick and professional 
Sjøfartsgata 10 Steinkjer

name: Lake and Road view
description: Along the road 465 are several spots to stop and stay for a night. Just drive slowly and look for gravel roads/places along the way. Coming from the E39, this was the last available spot we found. Was quiet, rarely any cars. The gravel road to the spot is a dead end. It's hard to turn the campervan if longer than 6m.

name: Skjerneset Bryggecamping
description:
A very nice campground with a small museum attached to it (free) the owner speaks german, english and norwegian and is super friendly, just pick a spot and around 7 jead to the office to pay (240kr for a tent and motorbike.)
There is power and water at each site and  the view is very nice.

ok with a tent but the ground is hard. bring a hammer ;)

wifi is free and available around the main building not at the campsites

name: Camp Nynessmel’n
description: Fisher camp with open huts, firewood trash cans near the river. Easy to stay here.

name: Down by the river
description: Nice place by the river. Lots of space for tents and easy access for motorcycles and cars. There is also a windshelter and a fireplace. Good 4G.

name: perdu au bord des chutes
description:
Translation: flat space allowing one or two vehicles to be parked along a path in the forest near a lake

espace plat permettant de garer un ou deux véhicules le long d un chemin dans la forêt à proximité d un lac

name: rest place with views
description: A hidden Parking spot with nice views. space for a few RVs, there is a little spot of grass for tents too, table and chairs

name: Dirt parking lot overlooking Bergen
description: A simple dirt parking lot, next to swing set and picnic table, that has a stunning, panoramic view of the city. This may not be a good spot to pitch a tent but I comfortably car camped here no problem

name: Amazing River Camping
description: You drive down a very short, narrow path that leads into a flat clearing with tables, next to the river with a glorious panoramic view of the mountain. A Stunning location

name: Røssvoll Camping
description:
Car + Tent 250 NOK, + 1P 50 NOK, + Washing Machine 50 NOK
There's an open cabin you can use to cook, use plates, table, electricity etc.
Place was closed when we came (off-season), but the receptionist lives nearby and helped us out.

name: Shelter Bråttjernane
description:
Nice Shelter next to a lake, even has a toilet nearby
Very quiet, a small tent fits in the Shelter to stay dry - beautiful view to the lake

name: beach
description: it's a beach, the gate closes at 22 so no car can go or get out past that time, but loads of people pith their tent or stay overnight in a campervan, there are toilets and tables for picnic. I stayed there with my car, couldn't pitch the tent because of heavy wind and I was by myself.

name: Svolvær Pampa Road
description:
About 6 minutes outside the city, undisturbed.  drive 200m further than the place on the other app...for us it was wet and 4x4 (vw t3) was necessary but successful.  Danger!  The road does not go back to the main road, you have to turn around, but there is room for small campers (vans etc.).  Showering is possible on the city square for 50nk.
There is a small abandoned house 50m in front, it is now empty in October, it may be used as a feeder for the animals in the summer.  Perfect for setting up a tent in the rain. The road is very rough and not good, especially when it rains - if necessary, run off beforehand!!!

name: Reindeer Heaven
description:
Beautiful spot at the end of a gravel road, right at a small lake. A little fire pit is at site. The ground is rocky and covered with moss. A small street is right next to it. Reachable just with a 4x4 and a bit of ground clearance.
There are a lot of reindeers and eagles.

name: Camp near lake
description: This spot is at the end of a small gravel road, next to a Creek feeding the lake. quiet but a little road noise from feeder road. pretty private. two vans camped around here when we arrived but everyone has their privacy..

name: Great view, by the road.
description: We stayed here over night and it was quiet, even though the place is at a road. Not many cars drive by at night. There is a bench and a trash bin. The view is great.

name: Little harbor
description: We followed a small road and ended up a a small harbor parking lot. It’s flat. A quiet place to spend the night. No toilets. Not suitable for tents. Some locals come here to their boats.
